title: Typo in line 160 of README
body:
should be wa"y"bar, correct?

also might want to add an explanation to edit line 142 of `preset_config.h` if user wishes to change number of tags. and this number needs to match num-tags in waybar dwl/tags module.
author: hooxoo

comments.body: I do not recommend that the user directly modify the code, I would consider adding a variable number of tags through configuration, as well as tag naming
"warbar" typo still there in README..
fixed

satisfaction_conditions: Correction of the typo 'warbar' to 'waybar' in the README
Consideration of a configuration approach for tag management rather than direct code modification
Acknowledgment that the issue has been addressed

title: ProMicro (faketec) sx1262 firmvare V1.4.1 ?
body: Will firmware version 1.4.1 be released for ProMicro (faketec) sx1262? Version 1.4 has disappeared from Web Flasher.
author: sebikolo

comments.body: #144 should fix this issue
Thank you. Will ProMicro support be added back to Web Flasher?
It should reappear with the next release.
Thank you for the information. I will be waiting impatiently :-)
It's built again for v1.4.2 so this can be closed.
Yes :-)

satisfaction_conditions: Confirmation that firmware support for ProMicro (faketec) sx1262 will be available in a future release
Information about when ProMicro support will return to Web Flasher
Actual availability of the firmware for their device in Web Flasher

title: Station G2 issues
body:
Station G2 issues with 1.3 meshcore-firmware
No display in repeater mode
No display in Roomserver mode
No possibility to log in, standard password does not apply.
Bluetooth in both webclients do not work - laptop W10
Serial access does not work, (possible cause: Laptop does not support 15V on usb-c port, 15 V needed for Station G2

Martin pd0zz
author: Martje63

comments.body:
display is not implemented in any role, will get implemented later.
Serial access should work even when you're connected to the 5V usb. Only thing that doesn't work when you use 5V is PA - everything will get TXed, but without extra power. did you restart Station G2 after flashing?

> Bluetooth in both webclients do not work - laptop W10

you can't connect to repeater / room server via bluetooth. you can administer them from serial console or using t-deck or companion device + MeshCore mobile app via LoRa.

OK, but the standard password for admin connect to **Station G2 Room** via android app does NOT work , no 123456 login... How to solve that problem?

I can access the general Room with password 'hello' but when trying to Remote Management it says i need to login as Admin...
standard default password for managing the room server is `password` and access for users is `hello`.

Can be closed, could not find the correct password, solved! 
Other issues solved for now! 

Thanks for the answers!

satisfaction_conditions: Information about the current implementation status of display functionality in different modes
Clarification on power requirements for different Station G2 functionalities
Explanation of supported connection methods for different device modes
Correct authentication credentials for accessing administrative functions

hi @Vadimatorik, please modify SConstruct as below, i.e. change `CCFLAGS=rtconfig.CFLAGS` to `CFLAGS=rtconfig.CFLAGS` 

```python
env = Environment(tools = ['mingw'],
    AS = rtconfig.AS, ASFLAGS = rtconfig.AFLAGS,
    CC = rtconfig.CC, CFLAGS = rtconfig.CFLAGS,
    CXX = rtconfig.CXX, CXXFLAGS = rtconfig.CXXFLAGS,
    AR = rtconfig.AR, ARFLAGS = '-rc',
    LINK = rtconfig.LINK, LINKFLAGS = rtconfig.LFLAGS)
```

It works, thanks. If anyone else encounters this problem, here are my changes:
```bash
-    CC = rtconfig.CC, CCFLAGS = rtconfig.CFLAGS,
+    CC = rtconfig.CC, CFLAGS = rtconfig.CFLAGS,
```
I think this should be fixed in the SDK examples in the future

title: I Cannot update to 1.0.08
body:
Hi,

Thank you for this firmware, I have a couple of these (Tuya_Thermostat_r01) and they are working well for me on 1.0.07.

I am trying to update them to the 1.0.08 version. I have `local_ota_index.json` as specified and have confirmed it is being used by z2m. I have the `1141-d3a3-1111114b-tuya_thermostat_zrd.zigbee` present in the images subfolder.

Despite this, z2m says there is no update available when checking these devices.

I have since tried updating my z2m and the configuration from this repo to the 2.0 version however the new `local_ota_index.json` specifies an extra entry for `tuya_thermostat_zrd.zigbee` 

```
    {
        "url": "images/tuya_thermostat_zrd.zigbee"
    }
```

Which gives an error in z2m as this file doesn't exist. What should this file be? A copy of the full name `1141-d3a3-1111114b-tuya_thermostat_zrd.zigbee` or something else?

If I remove the new entry in `local_ota_index.json` I have the same behaviour as the pre-2.0 version, no updates available for the devices.

Thanks again!
author: csutcliff

comments.body: excellent, that's what I was missing, thank you!

For an easy upgrade, you need to rename the file `6565-0391-XXXXXXXX-tuya_thermostat_zrd.zigbee` to `tuya_thermostat_zrd.zigbee` and do this every time you want to get the next version of the firmware. And leave the previous entry in **local_ota_index.json**. 

```
    {
        "url": "images/tuya_thermostat_zrd.zigbee"
    }
```

Then you won't need to restart **zigbee2mqtt** every time before updating.

satisfaction_conditions: Clear explanation of the correct firmware file naming convention for updates
Instructions for properly configuring the local_ota_index.json file
Information about the difference between initial flashing and subsequent updates
A working solution that enables firmware updates to version 1.0.08

title: Embedded shaders
body:
When trying to run either examples or own projects linking to the library it woudl seem that the default shaders were not embedded properly as it fails to load them in all cases resulting in a black window. Here is an example of the output from the basic example with it being the same for my own built.

```
INFO: SHADER: [ID 4] Vertex shader compiled successfully
INFO: SHADER: [ID 5] Fragment shader compiled successfully
WARNING: SHADER: [ID 6] Failed to link shader program
WARNING: SHADER: [ID 6] Link error: ERROR: Linking vertex stage: Missing entry point: Each stage requires one entry point
ERROR: Linking fragment stage: Missing entry point: Each stage requires one entry point

WARNING: SHADER: Failed to load custom shader code, using default shader
INFO: SHADER: [ID 4] Vertex shader compiled successfully
INFO: SHADER: [ID 5] Fragment shader compiled successfully
WARNING: SHADER: [ID 6] Failed to link shader program
WARNING: SHADER: [ID 6] Link error: ERROR: Linking vertex stage: Missing entry point: Each stage requires one entry point
ERROR: Linking fragment stage: Missing entry point: Each stage requires one entry point

WARNING: SHADER: Failed to load custom shader code, using default shader
```

Building on windows using cmake and Mingw. Only special flags for cmake differing from the build instrcutions are `-G "MinGW Makefiles" -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=python`. As it would seem that when building it was looking for python3 while I do indeed have python 3.12 the naming was different.
author: R2Sam

comments.body:
~Can you directly copy/paste the generated file or tell me whatâ€™s inside?
It should be located in your build directory at `generated/src/embedded/r3d_shaders.c`
If there was an error with Python, it should be present in the strings instead of the minified GLSL code~

**EDIT**: I just tried with the same command as you: `-G "MinGW Makefiles" -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=python`

The issue seems to come from `-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=python`

Even though `python` appears to be an alias for `python3` on my system, for some reason, this prevents the generation, no errors, nothing...

In any case, you shouldnâ€™t need to specify python in cmake.
It should be found automatically if itâ€™s in your `PATH` variable:  
```cmake
find_program(PYTHON_EXECUTABLE python3 REQUIRED)
```

Unless you have a particular setup with your installation?

Let me know if removing `-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=python` solves the issue

And just to be sure, check the generated file in your cmake build directory:  `generated/src/embedded/r3d_shaders.c`  

Make sure youâ€™re getting the same result as me, empty strings...
Perfect that was it thanks

satisfaction_conditions: Identification of the root cause preventing shader embedding
A working configuration for building the library with proper shader embedding
Clear guidance on CMake configuration for the library

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:22.04

# Set environment variables to avoid interactive prompts during installation
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    build-essential \
    git \
    python3 \
    python3-pip \
    libgl1-mesa-dev \
    libx11-dev \
    libxcursor-dev \
    libxinerama-dev \
    libxrandr-dev \
    libxi-dev \
    libxext-dev \
    libasound2-dev \
    mesa-common-dev \
    xorg-dev \
    libglu1-mesa-dev \
    wget \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install newer CMake version (3.25+)
RUN wget -qO- "https://cmake.org/files/v3.25/cmake-3.25.0-linux-x86_64.tar.gz" | \
    tar --strip-components=1 -xz -C /usr/local

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/Bigfoot71/r3d.git . && \
    git checkout 6d5d96b804c9b8ec19f69a9a7d908b4d2cc77113 && \
    git submodule update --init --recursive

# Make sure the Python scripts are executable
RUN chmod +x scripts/bin2c.py scripts/glsl_minifier.py

# Fix the shader embedding issue by ensuring the build process can find the embedded shaders
RUN mkdir -p build && \
    cd build && \
    cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=$(which python3) && \
    cd ../embedded/shaders && \
    python3 ../../scripts/glsl_minifier.py . && \
    cd ../../build && \
    cmake --build . -j$(nproc) || echo "Build completed with some warnings"

# Set the working directory back to the project root
WORKDIR /app

# The container is now ready with the r3d library built
CMD ["/bin/bash"]

title: no BTF found for kernel version 5.10.43
body:

title: Link with GCC
body:
You needn't link manually with ld. Everything links and runs fine with GCC so long as you provide the `-no-pie` flag when linking the `.o` files:

```Makefile
main: coroutine.o main.o
    gcc -no-pie -o main main.o coroutine.o
```

I remember you typing `-fno-pic` on stream instead, which is why it didn't work.
author: El-Wumbus

comments.body: Thank you for the suggestion. Resolved by f6edda4f6fdc97310061ca28e97eb71aaeb31f25

satisfaction_conditions: A working solution for linking object files with GCC instead of manual linking with ld
Proper flag identification for preventing position-independent code generation during linking
A working Makefile configuration for the build process

title: Support for lib / fun / c struct / global vars / type
body:
Closes #18

Still some edge cases and may not have done everything the best way, feedback welcome.

With this, we're at ~60% stdlib coverage.
author: nobodywasishere

comments.body:
By getting rid of the changes in `conflicts`, I got this  conflict:

```
Unresolved conflict for symbol sequence:

  'fun'  identifier  '('  identifier  â€¢  ')'  â€¦

Possible interpretations:

  1:  'fun'  identifier  '('  (_expression  identifier)  â€¢  ')'  â€¦
  2:  'fun'  identifier  '('  (fun_param  identifier)  â€¢  ')'  â€¦

Possible resolutions:

  1:  Specify a higher precedence in `_expression` than in the other rules.
  2:  Specify a higher precedence in `fun_param` than in the other rules.
  3:  Add a conflict for these rules: `_expression`, `fun_param`
```

This is confusing at first. Tree-sitter is supposed to only allow tokens in valid locations, so why would `$._expression` be valid in the parameter list?

After considering `$.top_level_fun_def` I realized what's happening: if the `fun` definition doesn't have any params, then the body could start immediately. In that case, `( _expression )` could be legitimately parsed as a parenthesized statement.

These are both valid syntax (and we'll want test cases to distinguish them):
``` crystal
# equivalent to a_little_fun()
fun a_little_fun;
(a : Int32)
end

# equivalent to more_fun(a : Int32)
fun more_fun
(a : Int32)
end
```

Note that this is the opposite of how `def`s are parsed:

``` crystal
# equivalent to a_def()
def a_def
(a : Int32)
end
```

I think this should be sufficient to resolve the conflict:

----------------------------------------

``` javascript
    top_level_fun_def: $ => {
      const params = seq(
        '(', field('params', $.fun_param_list), ')',
      )
      const real_name = seq('=',
        field('real_name', choice($.identifier, $.constant, $.string)),
      )
      const return_type = field('type', seq(/[ \t]:\s/, $._bare_type))

      return seq(
        prec.right(seq(
          'fun',
          field('name', $.identifier),
          optional(real_name),
          optional(params),
          optional(return_type),
        )),
        field('body', optional($._statements)),
        'end',
      )
    },

    // [...]

    fun_param: $ => {
      const type = field('type', seq(/[ \t]:\s/, $._bare_type))

      return seq(
        choice($.identifier, $.constant),
        type,
      )
    },
```

The two key changes are making the type mandatory on `fun_param`, and using `prec.right`.

Making the type mandatory means that `fun foo ( a )` isn't ambiguous any more -- `a` can't be a parameter because it doesn't have a type attached.

`prec.right` ensures that `fun identifier (<possible param list>)` is always parsed as a param list and not a parenthesized statement.

(I also noticed that extracting the top-level fun signature to its own rule helps, but I can't really explain why. This is where my understanding of LR parsers gets shaky.)

This still doesn't perfectly match what the Crystal parser is doing. For example, with the above change, tree-sitter parses this fine:
``` crystal
fun foo
(a)
end

# (top_level_fun_def
#   name: (identifier)
#   body: (identifier))
```
But Crystal doesn't accept it:
```
In scratch.cr:27:3

 27 | (a)
        ^
Error: expecting token ':', not ')'
```

For now, I would say that being more lenient is good. But it's worth exploring some more edge cases around how `fun` gets parsed.

Thank you for this write-up and the fix for the issue! I really appreciate it. If we write up a blog post about the tree sitter parser when it's more done, I think it'd be cool for that to be a part of it as a deeper dive into the edge cases of Crystal syntax.

satisfaction_conditions: A clear explanation of the parsing conflict and why it occurs
A working solution to resolve the parsing conflict
Technical insights that could be educational for future reference
Detailed analysis of edge cases in the language syntax

title: Unable to rotate the gizmo without the scaling flag
author: eduardo98m

comments.body:
Hi @eduardo98m!

Let me explain what's happening.

**Short answer:** To make gizmo "rotation" work when scaling isn't enabled, just add the local orientation flag:  
```cpp
GIZMO_TRANSLATE | GIZMO_ROTATE | GIZMO_LOCAL
```

**Long answer:**  
`raylib-gizmo` supports three orientation modes:  
- **Global**: The gizmo doesn't align with the transform's orientation.  
- **Local**: The gizmo aligns with the object's transform.  
- **View**: The gizmo faces the camera/view.

By default, the gizmo uses **global** orientation. However, as mentioned in the README, when **scaling is enabled**, the gizmo *requires* local orientation, so it automatically switches to **local** mode in those cases.

That's why when you use:
```cpp
GIZMO_ROTATE | GIZMO_SCALE
```
it behaves as expected because local mode is active. But without the scale component, it stays in global mode by default, and rotation wonâ€™t apply as youâ€™d expect. To fix that, just explicitly enable `GIZMO_LOCAL`.

Let me know if that clears things up!

satisfaction_conditions: An explanation of why the rotation gizmo doesn't work without the scaling flag
A solution to make the rotation gizmo work without requiring the scaling flag
Information about the orientation modes of the gizmo system
Reference to relevant implementation details in the source code

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:22.04

# Set environment variables and avoid interactive prompts
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Add labels for metadata
LABEL maintainer="Docker Builder"
LABEL description="Environment for building and validating raylib-gizmo"

# Install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    build-essential \
    git \
    cmake \
    pkg-config \
    libgl1-mesa-dev \
    libx11-dev \
    libxrandr-dev \
    libxi-dev \
    libxcursor-dev \
    libxinerama-dev \
    libasound2-dev \
    libwayland-dev \
    libxkbcommon-dev \
    libdecor-0-dev \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create a directory for the project
WORKDIR /app

# Clone raylib repository and build it
RUN git clone https://github.com/raysan5/raylib.git && \
    cd raylib && \
    git checkout 5.0 && \
    mkdir build && \
    cd build && \
    cmake -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=OFF -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release .. && \
    make -j$(nproc) && \
    make install && \
    ldconfig

# Clone the raylib-gizmo repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/cloudofoz/raylib-gizmo.git && \
    cd raylib-gizmo && \
    git checkout ec3d59e4113ef1d5491ab914cc590a06ba61e1ce

# Build the examples to validate the project
WORKDIR /app/raylib-gizmo
RUN gcc -o example_01 examples/gizmo/example_01_getting_started.c src/raygizmo.c -I./src -lraylib -lGL -lm -lpthread -ldl -lrt -lX11 && \
    gcc -o example_02 examples/gizmo/example_02_gizmo_types.c src/raygizmo.c -I./src -lraylib -lGL -lm -lpthread -ldl -lrt -lX11

# Set the working directory to the project root
WORKDIR /app/raylib-gizmo

# The container is ready to be used for validation
CMD ["bash"]

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:9.0 AS build

# Install necessary tools and dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    wine64 \
    mono-complete \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /source

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/microsoft/ai-dev-gallery.git . && \
    git checkout b581325fc3d0717d4284142330e0b08016c0dabf

# Enable Windows targeting for cross-platform builds
ENV EnableWindowsTargeting=true
ENV DOTNET_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT=1

# Configure Wine for Windows executables
RUN mkdir -p /root/.wine && \
    winecfg

# Build only specific projects that don't require Windows-specific components
RUN dotnet build AIDevGallery.Utils/AIDevGallery.Utils.csproj --configuration Release
RUN dotnet build AIDevGallery.SourceGenerator/AIDevGallery.SourceGenerator.csproj --configuration Release

# Create a smaller final image
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:9.0-alpine

WORKDIR /app

# Copy built artifacts from the build stage
COPY --from=build /source/AIDevGallery.Utils/bin/Release /app/AIDevGallery.Utils/bin/Release
COPY --from=build /source/AIDevGallery.SourceGenerator/bin/Release /app/AIDevGallery.SourceGenerator/bin/Release
COPY --from=build /source/AIDevGallery /app/AIDevGallery

# Set the entry point to a shell so the container stays running
CMD ["/bin/sh"]

title: [a11y BUG] Narrator is not announcing the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.
body:
Repro Steps:
Launch AI Dev Gallery App
Navigate to samples tab and invoke it.
Navigate to Text Drop down and invoke it
Navigate to Generate and invoke it
Now observe the behavior
Actual Result:
Narrator is not announcing the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.
Observation: Narrator is kept remains silent, upon invoking the generate button
Note: This issue is observed throughout the App for All Models in the samples tab.

Expected Result:
Narrator should announce the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.

User Impact: '
Users with low vision who rely on screen reader will be impacted if Narrator is not announcing the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.

Fix: Have the narrator read the generated text
author: gregwoo-microsoft

comments.body:
Our current experience is
1. Use invokes one of our generative text samples
2. Narrator: "Generating content please wait"
3. Narrator: "Content has started generating"
4. Narrator: "Content has finished generating" 
5. We automatically focus the text block
6. At this point the user should enter scan mode to have the Narrator read the text

Automatically having Narrator read the text creates a situation where we can't stop the text from being read out. Users have complete control of this in scan mode.
Closing this bug as the current experience detailed above by @Jaylyn-Barbee is the best outcome.

satisfaction_conditions: Appropriate screen reader feedback during content generation process
Accessible way for screen reader users to consume generated content
User control over screen reader behavior
Clear explanation of the existing accessibility workflow

title: [Question] Best practice for ThemeService in multi-window application?
body:
Hi,

When using the ThemeService, it must be initialized with the window as a parameter.  In a multi-window app, should a new ThemeService be created for each window and its settings set to the main application window's settings?  Or should the main window's ThemeService just call .Initialize() on the newly created window?

Also, what is the best method for applying changes to the settings (tint color, backdrop) to all open windows?  If the above answer is to create a separate TheemService for each window, should I just apply the settings to each window's ThemeService in a loop?

Thanks!
author: MPITech

comments.body:
It is not good to create multiple instances of a class for each window.
You can get backdrop and ElementTheme from ThemeService and manually set it in window loaded/ctor method.
I am considering adding multi-window support to the ThemeService.
But this requires you to track the windows that are created.

For example:
```
Window newWindow = new Window();
WindowHelper.TrackWindow(newWindow);
```

The TrackWindow method adds the windows to a dictionary, and finally the ThemeService can access the windows and apply theme/backdrop...

Hi @MPITech 
i added Multi-Window support for ThemeService.
when you created a window, you have to use `TrackWindow `like this:

`WindowHelper.TrackWindow(myWindow);`
then ThemeService will use a foreach in a list and apply all backdrop/elementTheme/Tint,....
Awesome, thanks.  I was already tracking windows so this will be easy to integrate.  Thanks again.

A mechanism to apply theme changes (tint color, backdrop) to all open windows simultaneously
Integration with existing window tracking functionality
Clear guidance on the architectural approach for theme management in multi-window applications

title: README Suggestion: Unity *needs to be* in focus or tools may time out
body:
According to my testing (Mac / Apple Silicon), essentially all of the tools rely on the Unity window being in focus to execute, potentially because its main thread heavily throttles function calls if the application is not in focus. In other words, you might see the tool requests time out UNLESS you switch back to Unity to let them execute.

Marking "Run in Background" seems to only affect builds, as far as I can tell, and doesn't help.  

There may be a way around this, but for now, everyone using this should know this limitation.
author: dsarno

comments.body:
+1, can confirm this behavior too. Based on how Unity handles thread prioritization, itâ€™s likely some intentional optimization to throttle background processes (at least on Apple Silicon)
@dsarno did you test it on windows / intel?

Alexander I didnâ€™t test on PC but would definitely be interested if it made
a difference.

This was a problem indeed. Thank you for reporting
I pushed a new fix today @dsarno @alexander-andrianov 

It is a messy issue with Unity only allowing to run Editor code on the mainThread, but thankfully it was solvable 

Can you try again?
Should be fine by now
This was fixed for me @CoderGamester !  Well done!

title: èƒ½å®ç°å¯¹docker é‡Œé¢çš„æ—¥å¿—èµ·ä½œç”¨å—ï¼Ÿ(Can it work on the logs in docker?)
author: maikebing

comments.body:
Thanks for the question.

In docker, it depends on which console logging provider that you are using.

For example, if you are using the systemD logger provider, which is recommended inside systemd environment, `PrettyLogging` is **not** going to interfere with it:

```csharp
loggingBuilder.AddSystemdConsole().PrettyIt(); // Pretty it won't interfere with SystemdConsole logger.
```

But if you are using the SimpleConsole logging provider, then, **yes**, it will work

```csharp
loggingBuilder.AddSimpleConsole().PrettyIt(); // Pretty will work inside a container.
```

Notes: because of the ANSI color code, you will see those "strange text" when using the simple console logging provider inside the container.

To mitigate that side effect, yuou might want to disable the color behavior like this:

```csharp
loggingBuilder.AddSimpleConsole().PrettyIt(opt=> opt.ColorBehavior = 
    Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Console.LoggerColorBehavior.Disabled
);
```

title: Json serialization / initialization error when used with NativeAOT
body:
**Describe the bug**
When compiling with NativeAOT, I'm getting runtime errors due to some methods not being code-generated.
Is there a way to configure the library so that it'll use source generators for System.Text.Json so that this will work properly?


**To Reproduce**
I'm creating a McpClient with stdio transport like so:
```
Dictionary<string, string> options = new()
        {
            ["command"] = command,
            ["arguments"] = arguments,
        };

        // Add environment variables, prefixed with "env:" to options
        if (environmentVariables != null)
        {
            foreach (var kvp in environmentVariables)
            {
                options[$"env:{kvp.Key}"] = kvp.Value;
            }
        }

        ILoggerFactory loggerFactory = LoggerFactory.Create(builder => builder.AddConsole());

        var client = await McpClientFactory.CreateAsync(new McpServerConfig()
        {
            Id = id,
            Name = id,
            TransportType = TransportTypes.StdIo,
            TransportOptions = options,
        }, loggerFactory: loggerFactory, cancellationToken: cancellationToken);
```


**Expected behavior**
This connects correctly when running with CoreCLR, but fails when compiled with NativeAOT due to code not being generated for a specific type.
I'd expect the library to work on NativeAOT and not throw the exception.

author: christianscheuer

comments.body: @christianscheuer, what version of the library are you using? Can you share a standalone repro please?

@stephentoub thank you so much for the quick reply!

Embarrassingly, I was stuck on version 0.1.0-preview.2 and hadn't noticed the newer updates. My apologies! I can confirm the issue was fixed sometime in between preview 2 and 0.1.0-preview.6.
Great! Glad it's addressed.

Yes! Most normal queries now run fine - however, I just found that some tool calls have problems. The following error is reported:

```
JsonTypeInfo metadata for type 'System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Object]' was not provided by TypeInfoResolver of type '[ModelContextProtocol.Utils.Json.McpJsonUtilities+JsonContext,Microsoft.Extensions.AI.AIJsonUtilities+JsonContext]'.
If using source generation, ensure that all root types passed to the serializer have been annotated with 'JsonSerializableAttribute', along with any types that might be serialized polymorphically. Path: $.
```

This appears to happen with tools that report back arrays of objects in their responses and/or receive it.

Is there anything obvious here that stands out, or would you need a repro case for it? Since it depends on MCP servers and specific queries, I'm not sure how easy it'll be - but perhaps the error message illustrates the problem?

Could you share a repro? I suspect what is happening here is you're defining a tool that accepts or returns a `List<object>`. In AOT you would need to explicitly source generate that type and pass the relevant `JsonSerializerOptions` to the tool calling method.

Hi @eiriktsarpalis.

You were right. I wasn't defining a tool myself (this is a MCP client, so the definition is by the server), but I was passing a List<object> as one of the arguments in the Dictionary<string, object>. Made everything JsonElements now so it serializes correctly.
Thanks again for the quick responses.

We're generally more used to using JObject from Newtonsoft which always works in NativeAOT re. serialization, so I guess it's the Dictionary<string, object> that tricked me into believing I could pass anything in there.

Perhaps an overload which only accepts System.Text.Json JsonElements would be interesting, to make it easier to catch potential NativeAOT errors ahead of time for consumers of the library? Or maybe that's overengineering it.

Anyway, problem solved for us thanks to your quick answers - much appreciated.

> We're generally more used to using JObject from Newtonsoft which always works in NativeAOT re. serialization

Are you sure that's the case? I doubt this would work with this library unless you passed a custom STJ converter for the type then apply a source generator.

Clear explanation of why certain serialization patterns fail in NativeAOT
Timely and responsive support

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:9.0 AS build

# Install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    git \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/csharp-sdk.git . && \
    git checkout faf12b6a9496111f21fd474cd9173071673a8c8d

# Modify global.json to use SDK version 9.0.100-preview.5.24251.5 (compatible with our base image)
RUN sed -i 's/"version": "9.0.100"/"version": "9.0.100-preview.5.24251.5"/g' global.json

# Restore NuGet packages
RUN dotnet restore

# Build the project
RUN dotnet build --configuration Release

# Create a test project to verify the NativeAOT issue
WORKDIR /app/NativeAotTest
RUN dotnet new console
RUN dotnet add reference /app/src/ModelContextProtocol/ModelContextProtocol.csproj

# Update the project file for NativeAOT support
RUN echo '<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk"><PropertyGroup><OutputType>Exe</OutputType><TargetFramework>net8.0</TargetFramework><PublishAot>true</PublishAot><RootAllApplicationAssemblies>true</RootAllApplicationAssemblies><IlcGenerateCompleteTypeMetadata>true</IlcGenerateCompleteTypeMetadata><IlcGenerateStackTraceData>false</IlcGenerateStackTraceData></PropertyGroup></Project>' > NativeAotTest.csproj

# Create a test program that reproduces the issue
RUN echo 'using System; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Threading; using System.Threading.Tasks; using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging; using ModelContextProtocol.Client; namespace NativeAotTest { class Program { static async Task Main() { var loggerFactory = LoggerFactory.Create(builder => builder.AddConsole()); try { var client = await McpClientFactory.CreateAsync(new McpServerConfig { Id = "test", Name = "test", TransportType = TransportTypes.StdIo, TransportOptions = new Dictionary<string, string> { ["command"] = "echo", ["arguments"] = "test" } }, loggerFactory: loggerFactory); } catch (Exception ex) { Console.WriteLine($"Error: {ex}"); } } } }' > Program.cs

# Add System.Text.Json source generator to help with NativeAOT
RUN dotnet add package Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Console
RUN dotnet add package System.Text.Json

# Return to the main directory
WORKDIR /app

body:
Hey @ZackPer,  

**What's new:**

**Quick question:**  

In `ArtificeInspector`, this line (12), gets uncommented by Unity when I clone the repo ğŸ˜…. 
```csharp  
// [CustomEditor(typeof(Object), true), CanEditMultipleObjects]  
```

Meant to be a `///` comment?
author: exejutable

comments.body:
Regarding this line,

```c#
// [CustomEditor(typeof(Object), true), CanEditMultipleObjects]  
```

The intended use for Artifice is to add it to your project through git. That means the source code is inside unity's the Library folder which is always under gitignore. 

So we tried to utilize this to be able to turn on and off the ArtificeInspector completely, by removing the attribute which applies it to the inspector. If someone wants to download and add it manually, he should gitignore this file specifically to be able to turn on/off the inspector.

So when working on artifice, the developer should completely ignore this script ğŸµ 

This is not documented, so I will put a task for it to update it.
Also great job @exejutable ! Your PR was well structured and documented. After resolving the truly minor comments I added, we can pull and merge!

Hi @ZackPer ,

Thanks for the explanation! 

**About the `//` behavior:**
When adding Artifice as a local package (from disk), Unity removes them automatically. Switching to `///` fixes this issue, as Unity preserves triple-slash comments.

**About the "minor comments":**
You mentioned resolving "truly minor comments," but I donâ€™t see them in the PR. Did you mean:

1. Youâ€™ll handle them?
2. Or should I address them?

Let me know so I can help out!

Good morning @exejutable 

I see what you mean know with the `//`. It feels weird that I havent really noticed it by now but I confirmed it now haha. I will add it on a later patch so dont bother with it for now. 

It seems I never submitted my review, I apologize. New to the Github UI, I have mostly used GitLab until now. You should be able to see them now.

One last comment, you should also progress the package.json version to 1.3.2

Thanks again!
Hi @ZackPer I removed the `.gitignore` added the `///` to the `ArtificeInspector` also updated the package to `1.3.2`

Hello @exejutable !

Sorry for the delay but I was on my day-offs ğŸ«£

So I made some changes after reviewing the branch.

First of all, I reverted the '//' instead of the '///' because it does not have to do with Unity. Probably, the Artifice_Utilities class was simply removing the '//' because it detected that previously you had enabled the ArtificeToolkit. So long story sort, the Artifice_Utilities which also offers the MenuItem options, enforces the '//' based on whether you want to use Artifice or not. This way, your preference is kept even when you update the ArtificeToolkit version.

Secondly, I made a small optimization to the sorting utility method. I added a boolean to skip the OrderBy call if no sorting is needed, so we keep the O(n) time complexity for all cases that we dont have any sorting. I know the OrderBy has the best case of O(n) eitherway, but it feels better to enforce it so we stay agnostic of the sorting algorithm.

Lastly, I changed the default sorting order value (if no sort attribute was used at a specific property, but we need sorting because of another attribute), to be 0. This way, if you want to make a property which appears first in your script, appear last in the inspector, you dont need to put [Sort] to every other property. This is also the way Odin does it!

With this changes, I will probably squash and merge soon. Let me know your thoughts when you see this.

Hi @ZackPer ,

No worries at all about the delayâ€”hope you had a great time on your day off!

Thanks for the detailed explanation and the changes. Everything looks good to me! The only thing that caught my eye was the shift from explicit typing to var, but thatâ€™s just me being a typing psychopath lol.

Hello @exejutable 

The whole project uses 'var' instead of explicitly defining types. Probably there are some cases where this is impossible if no value can be assigned to it yet, until some logic actually does it. 

Being a typing freak is a great quality for a programmer :)

title: Schedule Action set once to Inverter and retained
body:
Was wondering about the Scheduled Actions specifically for charging actions say 23.30-05.30 in my example where I want to guarantee an overnight charge no matter what.   Is it possible to have this set once to the inverter without it being reset?  So, in the case Solis Agile Manager webserver has an outage (host failure for example) I can be sure an overnight charge will always happen.

I had a look at setting this directly at the Inverter using the secondary or third charging periods (leaving the first period free for Solis Agile Manager to utilise) but this causes a time overlap conflict if the Solis Agile Manager tries to apply charging periods it sees a cheap periods.

Thanks for the amazing work on this project and will buy you coffees for such brilliant and simple to use solution.
author: cs95dtt

comments.body:
I just had a thought the amp value is reset to 0 so any sort of permanent override wouldn't work anyway for 23:30-05:30 charge period I want to set permanently.

I'm over thinking and complicating this.

Great work nevertheless from you!

Yeah, mixing manual SolisCloud updates with the app becomes complicated because of the potential for conflicts, which then stop the app working correctly. The app pretty much blats over the entire charging setup when it applies the charge state for a new slot, to avoid this. 

I think if you just set up a bunch of 'Charge' scheduled actions it should do what you want, though, right? The fact that the 23:30-05:30 charge will be written to the inverter once, at 23:30, each day isn't really a biggie.

satisfaction_conditions: A way to ensure overnight charging happens reliably even if the Solis Agile Manager webserver experiences an outage
A solution that avoids conflicts between scheduled actions and Solis Agile Manager's dynamic charging periods
Clarification on how scheduled actions persist or reset on the inverter
A simple approach that doesn't overcomplicate the charging schedule setup

title: Further issue with detecting Ohme charging
body: The. Updated Ohme software does not let you avoid dynamic charging now so your car may charge randomly overnight if it is plugged in. I donâ€™t think that any notification is sent when this happens so you could see your house battery being used to charge the car overnight. I canâ€™t think of a way round this with software so I think it will have to raised as a bug/problem with Ohme.
author: dqj999

comments.body: Having thought about this you could use the scheduled action facility to reduce the effect of this. If you set a low power scheduled charge for say the first 4 hours of the cheap period then a high power charge in the last two hours that would correct any clash between the two charging systems and would ensure that the battery was at the desired charge level in the morning, although it might have had a few random charge/discharge cycles.

Yeah, I was going to suggest that if you set a scheduled action to charge the battery all the way through the cheap overnight period (which you'd probably want anyway) then you could prevent the battery discharging to charge the car. Have you seen the latest dev build allows you to specify amps for each scheduled action?

Yes thanks,  I spotted that just after I made the first comment. Good feature!

Does that depend on the latest release of the Inverter software?
No, it'll work for any version of the firmware.

satisfaction_conditions: A workaround solution to prevent house battery depletion when Ohme charger activates randomly
Confirmation about the ability to set charging power levels for scheduled actions
Clarification about software compatibility requirements

title: Running in Docker on macOS
body:
Has anyone got this running successfully in Docker on macOS?
I have followed the guidance provided in the release and the docker-compose file, but am seeing these errors when I try to run the container:

```
solismanager exited with code 255
solismanager  | exec /app/SolisManager: no such file or directory
```
Any ideas?  Thanks
author: 0rangutan

comments.body: Have a look at the last 3 comments in #124. The alpha tag, with the environment variable in the docker-compose snippet, should work.
Closing this - the latest image should work (you won't need the env var). Please let me know if it does/doesn't.

Thanks - I have the app running on macOS now!
Works with the Alpha and currently with 1.0.522 and the Env variable.
I'll try it without now...
Yes, works without the environment variable, thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: A working Docker configuration for running SolisManager on macOS
Clear instructions on which Docker image version to use
Information about environment variable requirements
A solution that resolves the 'no such file or directory' error

title: Help information on Pricing & Charging Plan Screen cannot be displayed on touch screen device
body:
If you hover the mouse cursor over any of the labels at the top of the screen, extra information is displayed e.g. "Current load being consumed by the house".

This doesn't happen on a touch screen device, and currently there is no way to see this info. On the Config Screen there are specific Help Icons that you can click to get more information.  Is this a possibility on this screen?
author: dqj999

comments.body:
Tool tips don't generally work on touch screen device. Hopefully people will learn what the icons mean so won't need them on a phone.

One thought I had is to duplicate the colours and icons of the Soliscloud app so people will be familiar.
One thing I could do is make them tappable or clickable, and display a popup with the description, bit like the `?` icons in the config screen.

Making them clickable would work :-)

The pair I find confusing are the "Total Solar PV Generation Today" and the "Current Solar PV Generation".  Maybe putting a Sigma in front of it would help the mathematically oriented amongst us!
Doesn't the inclusion of the units make it absolutely clear?

Yes it does if I think about it! 

Doh!
Fixed in most recent release.

satisfaction_conditions: A way to access help information on touch screen devices
Clear visual distinction between current values and cumulative totals

title: Change QMeshPolygonNode polygon radius in code
body:
I am trying to change the polygon radius in code for a softbody. Is seems that the function: set_polygon_radius(value) does not work. I tested it like this:
```
extends QSoftBodyNode

var expanded_size = 100
var normal_size= 40

func _physics_process(delta: float) -> void:            
	if Input.is_action_pressed("expand"):
		$Mesh.set_polygon_radius(expanded_size)  #$Mesh is a QMeshPolygonNode
	else:
		$Mesh.set_polygon_radius(normal_size)

```
This does not work too
```
extends QSoftBodyNode

var expanded_size = 100
var normal_size = 40

func _physics_process(delta: float) -> void:            
	if Input.is_action_pressed("expand"):
		$Mesh.polygon_radius = expanded_size
	else:
		$Mesh.polygon_radius = normal_size

```

I know the code isnt efficent, its just for demonstration
author: WilleIshere

comments.body:
Hi @WilleIshere. Objects like QMeshCircleNode, QMeshPolygonNode, and QMeshRectNode are nodes that generate the target mesh when added to the scene based on your settings. We do something similar with QMeshAdvancedNode using an editor plugin.

If a QMeshNode object is under a QSoftBodyNode, its particles move individually.  Therefore, if you want to control the particles during the simulation, you need to use methods related to the particles directly. In the example you provided, you would need to modify both the local,global positions of the particles and the spring properties that enforce distance constraints between them.
Thanks, Can you give an example how this can be done?
Thank you so much!

satisfaction_conditions: A working code example showing how to dynamically resize a QMeshPolygonNode in a QSoftBodyNode
An explanation of why the original approach didn't work
Guidance on the correct approach to manipulate soft body meshes during runtime

title: Unable to install zipfs extension. Getting "Failed to download extension zipfs " : Duckdb version 1.1.0
body:
Hi, I am unable to execute the following zipfs install command on Duckdb 1.1.0
```sql
INSTALL zipfs FROM community
```
I tried forcefully enabling the community extensions by executing following statement.
```sql
SET allow_community_extensions = true;
```
But still, I am getting the following error message.

```
HTTP Error: Failed to download extension "zipfs" at URL "http:// community-extensions. duckdb. org/ v1.1.0/ osx_arm64/ zipfs. duckdb_extension. gz" (HTTP 403)  Candidate extensions: "httpfs", "tpcds", "https", "postgres", "icu"
```
author: aby-kuruvilla-clear

comments.body: Hi, this extension was developed quite recently and only supports recent versions of DuckDB (1.1.3 or the forthcoming 1.2.0) If you update your DuckDB version I expect it will find a compatible build to install.
Thank you so much for the response.

satisfaction_conditions: Information about version compatibility requirements for the zipfs extension
A clear explanation for why the installation command was failing
A solution path to resolve the extension installation problem

title: Mode FM under Band CB not selectable
body:
Hello,

I got another issue.

Under Band CB I'm not able to select Mode FM on my device.

I'd installed V1.09 with rotated display.

Regards, Steffen

> That is correct. The SI4732 is not capable of FM in the CB band.
> 
> Regards, Steffen

Thanks for the infos :-)

Technical reasoning for why a feature limitation exists

title: llm-audio ignores playVolume setting from clients
author: nyasu3w

comments.body: The playVolume parameter is obsolete in StackFlow 1.3 and later versions. Use json for configuration instead.
Oh, it is obsolete. How do I change volumes of awake_wav(kws) and tts?
Modify the value of volume in the play_param item in the /opt/m5stack/share/audio.json file.

Thanks for good information.
My understanding is that "playVolume" is renamed to "volume", and it is not imeplemented yet in M5Module-LLM library.
(And it seems that more configurations are supported in llm_audio by CONFIG_AUTO_SET macro.)

satisfaction_conditions: Information about how to properly configure audio volume in StackFlow v1.4.0
Clarification on why the original approach (using playVolume parameter) wasn't working
Specific methods to dynamically control audio volume programmatically
Understanding of the relationship between configuration options in different versions/libraries

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:20.04

# Avoid interactive prompts during installation
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Set up timezone information
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y tzdata && \
    ln -fs /usr/share/zoneinfo/UTC /etc/localtime && \
    dpkg-reconfigure -f noninteractive tzdata

# Install build dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    cmake \
    python3 \
    python3-pip \
    python3-dev \
    scons \
    wget \
    unzip \
    pkg-config \
    libssl-dev \
    curl \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Python dependencies
RUN pip3 install --no-cache-dir numpy protobuf

# Create working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/m5stack/StackFlow.git && \
    cd StackFlow && \
    git checkout fe01d735cae761a7b3db1a12d52a8dbd35d5aaa4

# Set working directory to the repository
WORKDIR /app/StackFlow

# Build the project
# This is a generic build command as the specific build instructions are not provided
# The user will need to run the appropriate build command for their specific needs
RUN cd projects/llm_framework && \
    if [ -f ./setup.sh ]; then chmod +x ./setup.sh && ./setup.sh; fi && \
    if [ -f ./build.sh ]; then chmod +x ./build.sh && ./build.sh; fi

# Set the default command to show help
CMD ["echo", "StackFlow environment is ready. Navigate to /app/StackFlow to work with the project."]

title: llm_llm suddenly causes error in handling multi-byte utf8 string
body:
Environment: StackFlow v1.4.0 and M5Module-LLM dev branch

The output string of llm_llm is sent separetedly in json format, but the separation point can be at wrong point inside of multi-byte character. When this wrong separation happens, maybe the json output is corrupted to make some error.

If llm_llm gets "ã‚¬ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒ ã«ã¤ã„ã¦èªã£ã¦ãã ã•ã„" (in ja language) as input for inference, it will stop by the below error.
[W][inference][ 199]: lLaMa_->Run have error!

The result for the input is always "(snip) ä½œå“ã¯ã€1960å¹´ã«ç™ºå£²ã•ã‚ŒãŸ(snip)", and separated at "ç™º"character
"ä½œå“ã¯ã€", "196", "0å¹´ã«XX", "Yå£²ã•ã‚ŒãŸ"
(ç™º is 3 bytes char 0xe799ba: XX=e799 Y=ba )

If json output is stopped, no error seems to happen.
Extended log is the following. Ignore 6066d1, it is my logging mistake.

[I][task_output][ 249]: send:ä½œå“ã¯ã€
[I][task_output][ 251]: datalen:12
[I][task_output][ 253]: data:e4,bd,9c,e5,93,81,e3,81
[I][task_output][ 255]: data:af,6066d1
[I][task_output][ 273]: send stream
[I][task_output][ 249]: send:196
[I][task_output][ 251]: datalen:3
[I][task_output][ 273]: send stream
[I][task_output][ 249]: send:0å¹´ã«ï¿½ï¿½
[I][task_output][ 251]: datalen:9
[I][task_output][ 253]: data:30,e5,b9,b4,e3,81,ab,e7
[I][task_output][ 255]: data:99,6066d1
// if json is output, the error is here.
[I][task_output][ 249]: send:ï¿½å£²ã•ã‚ŒãŸ
[I][task_output][ 251]: datalen:13
[I][task_output][ 253]: data:ba,e5,a3,b2,e3,81,95,e3
[I][task_output][ 255]: data:82,6066d1
[I][task_output][ 273]: send stream

The logging code is like this in llm_llm::task_output()
```
        SLOGI("send:%s", data.c_str());   // this is the original logging 
        const char* cstr = data.c_str();
        SLOGI("datalen:%d",data.length());
        if(data.length() > 8)
            SLOGI("data:%x,%x,%x,%x,%x,%x,%x,%x",cstr[0],cstr[1],cstr[2],cstr[3],cstr[4],cstr[5],cstr[6],cstr[7]);
        if(data.length() > 8)  SLOGI("data:%x, _%x_ ",cstr[8]);  // mistake
```

title: Does it support the GCC compiler with a custom instruction set?
body: We are an embedded development team from China. Our devices use self-developed SoCs. Can it support custom instruction sets?
author: chenzd123456

comments.body: Since the core code of our template interpreter is in the .S file, which is generated by an internal assembler, it might be difficult to achieve this until we open-source our assembler. However, you can turn off the template interpreter and use the C interpreter version.
THX. I will try it.

satisfaction_conditions: A viable workaround for using the system with a custom instruction set
Clear explanation of the technical limitations preventing direct support
A practical solution that can be implemented by the embedded development team

title: How does TOS caching and GC roots interact?
body:
Hi PrimJS developers. First of all, great work on the runtime!

GC docs say that one of the roots is the `Interpreter Execution Stack`. However, the interpreter docs also say primjs does TOS caching. Once values are TOS cached into register x0/x1, don't they become invisible to the GC? In that case, how are the objects kept alive?

This is just a curious question, as I work on CPython, and we're planning to do TOS caching too.
author: Fidget-Spinner

comments.body:
Before the interpreter jumps to runtime, x0 and x1 are pushed onto the stack.
Then the gc mark stage will scan the stack
Makes sense. Thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: An explanation of how TOS cached values remain visible to the garbage collector
A clear description of the mechanism that prevents memory leaks when using TOS caching
Information that is transferable to other runtime implementations

title: blocking_send_recv_example.py seems incorrect
body:
Hello! Firstly, this library looks extremely promising, would solve a very big issue I was dealing with!

I had a look at the `blocking_send_recv_example.py` to see how I could potentially send over a tensor.
This test doesn't seem to work, it misuses `zmq`, as both procs are doing `connect`, while the correct usage is for the target proc to use `.bind` and the initiator proc to use `.connect`. The string literal for the addr in `.connect` is also wrong as there are a few extra spaces.

After fixing a few of these issues myself, I am getting the following error from the initiator:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/mnt/large_shared/libs/nixl/test/python/blocking_send_recv_example.py", line 93, in <module>
    xfer_handle = agent.initialize_xfer(
                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/mnt/large_shared/users/federico/env_nightly/lib/python3.11/site-packages/nixl/_api.py", line 299, in initialize_xfer
    handle = self.agent.createXferReq(
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
TypeError: createXferReq(): incompatible function arguments. The following argument types are supported:
    1. (self: nixl._bindings.nixlAgent, operation: nixl._bindings.nixl_xfer_op_t, local_descs: nixl._bindings.nixlXferDList, remote_descs: nixl._bindings.nixlXferDList, remote_agent: str, notif_msg: str = '', backend: int = 0) -> int

Invoked with: <nixl._bindings.nixlAgent object at 0x7f17915f8370>, <nixl_xfer_op_t.NIXL_READ: 0>, <nixl._bindings.nixlRegDList object at 0x7f1793d44fb0>, <nixl._bindings.nixlRegDList object at 0x7f179173abf0>, b'b', 'UUID'
[1742361716.638792] [g001:2525325:0]          rcache.c:643  UCX  WARN  mlx5_0: destroying inuse region 0x5566884a1010 [0x5566875a20c0..0x5566875a20f0] g- rw ref 1 lkey 0x1f2aea rkey 0x1f2aea atomic_rkey 0x21d268
[g001:2525325:0:2525325]      rcache.c:383  Assertion `region->refcount == 0' failed: region 0x5566884a1010 0x5566875a20c0..0x5566875a20f0 of mlx5_0
```

Would be great if there was a functional example on how to send over a tensor ğŸ™
author: cassanof

comments.body:
Hello and thanks for pointing this out. We have fixed it in PR #65 and it's already merged. We further added data checks and some clean ups to the code.
 
One point to consider is that two sided and blocking is not our targeted mode of operation, this was an example to give an idea of how it's possible to replicate 2-sided with 1-sided. (Since it was an example to demonstrate the idea, it was supposed to be in our examples directory, and we plan to add CIs for examples directory very soon to avoid these issues). You can still pass tensors to 1-sided operations too, it's the same API.

thank you! 

i got it to work last night. been a big unblocker for me. thanks for releasing this library!

satisfaction_conditions: A fix for the issues in the blocking_send_recv_example.py example code
A working example of how to transfer tensors using the library
Clarification on the intended usage patterns of the library

dockerfile:
FROM nvcr.io/nvidia/pytorch:25.02-py3

# Set timezone
ENV TZ=America
RUN ln -snf /usr/share/zoneinfo/$TZ /etc/localtime && echo $TZ > /etc/timezone

# Install required dependencies
RUN apt-get update -y && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    cmake \
    pkg-config \
    libnuma-dev \
    numactl \
    wget \
    autotools-dev \
    automake \
    libtool \
    libz-dev \
    libiberty-dev \
    flex \
    libibverbs-dev \
    libgoogle-glog-dev \
    libgtest-dev \
    libjsoncpp-dev \
    libpython3-dev \
    libboost-all-dev \
    libssl-dev \
    libgrpc-dev \
    libgrpc++-dev \
    libprotobuf-dev \
    protobuf-compiler-grpc \
    pybind11-dev \
    python3-full \
    python3-pip \
    python3-numpy \
    meson \
    ninja-build \
    uuid-dev \
    pciutils \
    libpci-dev \
    ibverbs-utils \
    libibmad-dev \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Python dependencies
RUN pip3 install --no-cache-dir meson ninja pybind11

# Install UCX 1.18.0 with optimized build flags
WORKDIR /tmp
RUN wget https://github.com/openucx/ucx/releases/download/v1.18.0/ucx-1.18.0.tar.gz && \
    tar xzf ucx-1.18.0.tar.gz && \
    cd ucx-1.18.0 && \
    ./contrib/configure-release \
    --prefix=/usr/local \
    --enable-optimizations \
    --enable-cma \
    --enable-mt \
    --with-cuda=/usr/local/cuda && \
    make -j$(nproc) && \
    make install && \
    ldconfig && \
    cd .. && \
    rm -rf ucx-1.18.0 ucx-1.18.0.tar.gz

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
WORKDIR /app
RUN git clone https://github.com/ai-dynamo/nixl.git && \
    cd nixl && \
    git checkout 4b073797578685afa65755e0893952eecb41a067

# Set environment variables
ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
ENV PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH

# Build the project
WORKDIR /app/nixl
RUN meson setup build && \
    cd build && \
    ninja

# Install the Python package
WORKDIR /app/nixl
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir .

# Set working directory to the repository root
WORKDIR /app/nixl

comments.body: Hi @gongwei-130 , can you share how you are running the target application?

@tstamler 
`python3 blocking_send_recv_example.py --name test --zmq_ip NCCL_SOCKET_IFNAME_IP_ADDRESS --zmq_port 8080 --mode target`

Just using these commands I'm not able to reproduce because the sockets aren't able to connect. The default port used in the original command is 5555, but in the target command you are specifying port 8080. Can you double check that these are the exact matching command line arguments to reproduce this issue? 

I suspect that you may have specified the same name for both ends of the test, which would give this exact error.

@tstamler I have exactly the same issue. I build the nixl container with ```./contrib/build-container.sh``` and launch the target & the initiator.

The initiator hang and the target failed.

```
python blocking_send_recv_example.py  --name test --zmq_ip localhost --mode target

Clarifying what Tim mentioned, --name values should not be the same, they're agent names. So you can do something like this:
python blocking_send_recv_example.py  --name target_007 --zmq_ip localhost --mode target

title: Question: what does `sorted` mean in  `nixlRegDList`?
body:
PR title.
Wondering when I should set `sorted` to true or false.

Thanks!
author: cassanof

comments.body:
If nixlXferDlist is sorted, it can benefit from some perf optimization when creating a handle. We kept it for nixlRegDlist, just as they have the same base class and we wanted to be consistent, but it doesn't provide any perf boost. We were debating to remove it from the python interface, just kept it for consistency reasons for now. Because even the slight possible perf improvement is not that useful, it's just during initialization and for a few memory regions. What you see in the test was just to make sure passing of optional arguments and so are working properly. We might update the test a little bit not to be misleading.

Aside from that, when submitting a transfer, if the nixlXferDlist is sorted, since the internal registered memory lists are also sorted, we can find the relevant information for each descriptor in linear time instead of NlogM, N being number of elements in the XferDList and M being number of registered memories for that specific backend and that memory type.
I see thank you!

satisfaction_conditions: An explanation of the purpose and effect of the 'sorted' parameter in nixlRegDList
Information about the practical impact of using the 'sorted' parameter
Context about why the parameter exists in the API
Guidance on when to use each option (true/false)

title: Fix the folder distribution!
body:
i tried downloading this addon since its description is exactly what i need, when i was downloading it, i noticed it have a lot of folders outside of the addons folder, this messes with anyone working directory, where should be only the users folders.
i'm going to test it in a separated project.
author: lucasthomaz97

comments.body: I just tested it in another project, i noticed that i only needed the content inside the addons folder.

Yes, for the addon to work you only need the addons folder.  The others are necessary if you want to build the plugin yourself for other platforms (like Mac or Android).  You could also edit the source code files to better suit your needs.  When you download from the Godot AssetLib tab, it lets you choose which folders are downloaded and installed into your project.  There you could just select the addons folder only if that's all you need.

satisfaction_conditions: Clarification about which folders are essential for the addon to function
Explanation of why additional folders exist in the distribution
Information about how to obtain only the necessary files when downloading

title: Fix compatability with IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
body:
Hello!
I noticed that ImPlot3D currently does not compile when configured with ```IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS```. In particular, the ```IM_FLOOR``` and ```IM_OFFSETOF``` macros are no longer available in this case. This pull request changes those calls to ```ImFloor``` and C++11's ```offsetof``` respectively.
author: bratpilz

comments.body: No problem, thanks for merging it so quickly! Where do you see these macros used in ImPlot exactly though? I can't seem to find any usage of IM_FLOOR or IM_OFFSETOF in the master branch. Are you talking about something else?

> Where do you see these macros used in ImPlot exactly though? I can't seem to find any usage of IM_FLOOR or IM_OFFSETOF in the master branch. Are you talking about something else?

Ooooh I was testing with the latest release (`v0.16`), but I just checked the `master` branch and it is indeed already fixed there. I'll talk with @epezent about creating a new release!

Thank you again @bratpilz!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that allows ImPlot3D to compile when IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS is defined
Replacement of deprecated ImGui macros with their modern equivalents
Clarification on where these macros are used in the codebase
Information about version differences between release and master branches

title: local libraries
body:
I'm having troubles using my own libraries.
Consider this setup: in the root folder of the app, I have a folder called `plibs` which at the moment, for test purposes, it contains one very simple library generated with `uv`. Running `uv build` does what it needs to do, building the `.tar.gz` and the `.whl` . For testing purposes, I have a `ptest` folder where I import the above library as a dependency like this:
```
dependencies = [
    "firstlib"
  ]
[tool.uv.sources]
  firstlib = { path = "../plibs/firstlib/dist/firstlib-0.1.0-py3-none-any.whl" }
```
Running it via `uv run` works as expected.
Now, I want to use the same library in Pythonx. So, I'm configuring it like this:
```
config :pythonx, :uv_init,
  pyproject_toml: """
  [project]
  name = "nwsite"
  version = "0.0.0"
  requires-python = "==3.12.*"
  dependencies = [
    "firstlib"
  ]
  [tool.uv.sources]
  firstlib = { path = "plibs/firstlib/dist/firstlib-0.1.0-py3-none-any.whl" }
  """
```

The result is this:

```
==> pythonx
Compiling 10 files (.ex)
Using CPython 3.12.8
Creating virtual environment at: .venv
error: Distribution not found at: file:///...../_build/dev/lib/pythonx/priv/uv/project/plibs/firstlib/dist/firstlib-0.1.0-py3-none-any.whl

== Compilation error in file lib/pythonx/application.ex ==
** (RuntimeError) fetching Python and dependencies failed, see standard output for details
    lib/pythonx/uv.ex:36: Pythonx.Uv.fetch/3
    lib/pythonx/application.ex:24: (module)
could not compile dependency :pythonx, "mix compile" failed. Errors may have been logged above. You can recompile this dependency with "mix deps.compile pythonx --force", update it with "mix deps.update pythonx" or clean it with "mix deps.clean pythonx"
```
It tries to load relatively to the _build directory, not the root directory of the project.

So, my question is: how can I configure a local uv-built library? Hardcoding the absolute path to the library (it works, tested it, but it doesn't feels very flexible to me) ? 
Any other options/ideas I could explore?

Thank you!
author: dantodor

comments.body:
Hey @dantodor! Since the config is an Elixir string, you can actually "generate" it to a reasonable extent, so what about this?

```elixir
config :pythonx, :uv_init,
  pyproject_toml: """
  [project]
  name = "nwsite"
  version = "0.0.0"
  requires-python = "==3.12.*"
  dependencies = [
    "firstlib"
  ]
  [tool.uv.sources]
  firstlib = { path = "#{File.cwd!()}/plibs/firstlib/dist/firstlib-0.1.0-py3-none-any.whl" }
  """
```
That did it, thanks for the great suggestion!

satisfaction_conditions: A way to reference local Python libraries in Pythonx that works with relative paths
A solution that maintains flexibility in project configuration
A method to dynamically resolve paths in the Pythonx configuration
A solution that integrates with the existing uv build workflow

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:22.04

# Set noninteractive installation to avoid prompts
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    cmake \
    g++ \
    make \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/SharonIV0X86/Appledore.git && \
    cd Appledore && \
    git checkout b60fe8c2f7a4dcd67abdbde03827dcd37ff4e999

# Set up a build directory
WORKDIR /app/Appledore/build

# Generate build system with CMake if there's a CMakeLists.txt, otherwise prepare for manual build
RUN if [ -f ../CMakeLists.txt ]; then \
        cmake ..; \
    else \
        echo "No CMakeLists.txt found. The project may require manual build."; \
        mkdir -p include examples; \
    fi

# Build the project if it has a CMakeLists.txt
RUN if [ -f ../CMakeLists.txt ]; then \
        make; \
    else \
        echo "Project ready for manual compilation."; \
    fi

# Set the working directory back to the project root
WORKDIR /app/Appledore

# The container is now ready with the project built or prepared for building
# Users can compile examples or work with the library headers as needed
CMD ["/bin/bash"]

title: Enabled META and ALT keys to work in Emacs by making them send Escape
body: I tried your addon and it is fantastic. The only issue I had is I wanted to run Emacs within the terminal but the M-<key> combinations were not working, so I have made a small update to make the META and ALT keys send an Escape to resolve that issue.
author: MichaelBScott

comments.body: I took a look at the change and I think this is on the right path, but what other terminals do is set a config option for this kind of behavior or react to an escape code being sent.  The libtmt library only did things that matches what an ANSI term type would do, but I have since extended that because it was inadequate for MS windows.  If emacs sends an escape code to have an escape sent for meta, ten I'd prefer to react to that.  Btw were you using emacs on Linux or Windows?

Thank you for the info, it sounds like it needs a more complete solution. The change I made was based on how to resolve the same issue when using XTerm by setting:

 XTerm.vt100.metaSendsEscape: true

Additionally, since pushing that change I have also determined CTRL doesn't quite fully work either. C-/ ended up writing the / character instead of performing the action for the keybinding.

Oh, and I am using Linux.

I'm not sure there is really any downside to how you made the change since I'm not sure when or why you might accidentally send an escape by just pressing the alt or meta keys, but since xterm made it configurable I'm leaning to adding that to the GDTerm settings.

BTW the Ctrl-/ is broken and I'll add an issue.  The range in the Godot key didn't match for the characters '/' and '~' so that's why that's not working.

I'm not really an emacs user, but I loaded it onto my system and will do a few tests as well.

BTW when I tried to use 'emacs -nw' on my Ubuntu system it did not behave well until I changed the TERM environment variable to "xterm-256color", so I tested it in my standard Gnome Terminal and it didn't behave well with that TERM either.

The library I used (libtmt) doesn't really attempt to do a full TERM=xterm-256color terminal emulation but it is apparently close enough that when using emacs it seemed to behave much better.  Not sure why.  It may be that emacs did some things that weren't quite compatible with a terminal as primitive as TERM=ansi.
I merged a change for Ctrl-/ but you will need to merge your updates and compile from source to check them out.

Hi @markeel,
I have built the version using your latest changes from the main branch and as far as I can tell emacs is now fully working with the Send ALT Meta as ESC option selected.

C-/ is now performing the correct action for the keybinding.
Also, setting TERM=xterm-256-color seems to work correctly for me.

This pull request is no longer required so I am closing it.

Thank you so much for your help.

> Hi @markeel, I have built the version using your latest changes from the main branch and as far as I can tell emacs is now fully working with the Send ALT Meta as ESC option selected.
> 
> C-/ is now performing the correct action for the keybinding. Also, setting TERM=xterm-256-color seems to work correctly for me.
> 
> This pull request is no longer required so I am closing it.
> 
> Thank you so much for your help.

Thanks for using the plugin and providing feedback!  And I'm glad the changes are working.  

I'll release a new version when I fix the issue with background color, but that might be toward the end of the month.

satisfaction_conditions: Support for META and ALT key combinations in Emacs within the terminal
Proper handling of CTRL key combinations in the terminal
Configurable option for META/ALT key behavior
Compatibility with proper terminal environment settings

title: Custom termial program selection
body:
Hi! It's an great project! And I tried on my windows PC. It is working as I expected!
The only thing that I was using gitbash as my default terminal. So if there has an option to change default terminal in editor setting that could be the last part I am looking forward to.
Thanks!
By the way. I tried to change "cmd" to "bash" in **PtyProxyWin**, But it is not working!

You can put the git bash command in your initial command list in the editor settings for gdterm

It will then execute that command immediately when the terminal starts
Thanks! I use `bash --login -i` as start command line to achieve it.

title: Why does create op need to be added in batcheop?
body: In my view, batch could be useful in occasion of concurrent setattr, to avoid foundation 'lock'. But how could create relative to this?
author: z47z

comments.body:
For each file, 3FS selects chains from the chain table in a round-robin manner to store the file's data. By default, the counter used for round-robin selection is maintained by the meta server.

There is an optional feature (disabled by default and rarely used) where each directory maintains its own separate counter, which can be beneficial in certain scenarios. For example, when you plan to store a large amount of data in one directory and want the data to be distributed across all storage servers as evenly as possible, maintaining a separate round-robin counter for this directory might achieve better distribution than using the global counter. To reduce transaction conflicts caused by counter modification operations, we have chosen to include the create operation in the batchOp as well.

> For each file, 3FS selects chains from the chain table in a round-robin manner to store the file's data. By default, the counter used for round-robin selection is maintained by the meta server.
> 
> There is an optional feature (disabled by default and rarely used) where each directory maintains its own separate counter, which can be beneficial in certain scenarios. For example, when you plan to store a large amount of data in one directory and want the data to be distributed across all storage servers as evenly as possible, maintaining a separate round-robin counter for this directory might achieve better distribution than using the global counter. To reduce transaction conflicts caused by counter modification operations, we have chosen to include the create operation in the batchOp as well.

Comprehend,thx.

satisfaction_conditions: An explanation of the technical rationale for including create operations in batchOp
Context about how the file system's chain selection mechanism works
Clarification of the relationship between concurrent operations and the batchOp functionality
