title: [BUG] Cava config as template doesn't parse correctly and no errors are shown.
body:
The cava config does not parse correctly and results in a incorrect output file.


TEMPLATE:
```
## Configuration file for CAVA. Default values are commented out. Use either ';' or '#' for commenting.


[general]

# Smoothing mode. Can be 'normal', 'scientific' or 'waves'. DEPRECATED as of 0.6.0
; mode = normal

# Accepts only non-negative values.
framerate = 60

# 'autosens' will attempt to decrease sensitivity if the bars peak. 1 = on, 0 = off
# new as of 0.6.0 autosens of low values (dynamic range)
# 'overshoot' allows bars to overshoot (in % of terminal height) without initiating autosens. DEPRECATED as of 0.6.0
; autosens = 1
; overshoot = 20

# Manual sensitivity in %. If autosens is enabled, this will only be the initial value.
# 200 means double height. Accepts only non-negative values.
; sensitivity = 100

# The number of bars (0-200). 0 sets it to auto (fill up console).
# Bars' width and space between bars in number of characters.
; bars = 0
; bar_width = 2
; bar_spacing = 1

# For SDL width and space between bars is in pixels, defaults are:
; bar_width = 20
; bar_spacing = 5


# Lower and higher cutoff frequencies for lowest and highest bars
# the bandwidth of the visualizer.
# Note: there is a minimum total bandwidth of 43Mhz x number of bars.
# Cava will automatically increase the higher cutoff if a too low band is specified.
; lower_cutoff_freq = 50
; higher_cutoff_freq = 10000


# Seconds with no input before cava goes to sleep mode. Cava will not perform FFT or drawing and
# only check for input once per second. Cava will wake up once input is detected. 0 = disable.
; sleep_timer = 0


[input]

# Audio capturing method. Possible methods are: 'pulse', 'alsa', 'fifo', 'sndio' or 'shmem'
# Defaults to 'pulse', 'alsa' or 'fifo', in that order, dependent on what support cava was built with.
#
# All input methods uses the same config variable 'source'
# to define where it should get the audio.
#
# For pulseaudio 'source' will be the source. Default: 'auto', which uses the monitor source of the default sink
# (all pulseaudio sinks(outputs) have 'monitor' sources(inputs) associated with them).
#
# For alsa 'source' will be the capture device.
# For fifo 'source' will be the path to fifo-file.
# For shmem 'source' will be /squeezelite-AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF where 'AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF' will be squeezelite's MAC address
method = pulse
source = auto

; method = alsa
; source = hw:Loopback,1

; method = fifo
; source = /tmp/mpd.fifo
; sample_rate = 44100
; sample_bits = 16

; method = shmem
; source = /squeezelite-AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF

; method = portaudio
; source = auto


[output]

# Output method. Can be 'ncurses', 'noncurses', 'raw' or 'sdl'.
# 'noncurses' uses a custom framebuffer technique and prints only changes
# from frame to frame in the terminal. 'ncurses' is default if supported.
#
# 'raw' is an 8 or 16 bit (configurable via the 'bit_format' option) data
# stream of the bar heights that can be used to send to other applications.
# 'raw' defaults to 200 bars, which can be adjusted in the 'bars' option above.
#
# 'sdl' uses the Simple DirectMedia Layer to render in a graphical context.
; method = ncurses

# Visual channels. Can be 'stereo' or 'mono'.
# 'stereo' mirrors both channels with low frequencies in center.
# 'mono' outputs left to right lowest to highest frequencies.
# 'mono_option' set mono to either take input from 'left', 'right' or 'average'.
; channels = stereo
; mono_option = average

# Raw output target. A fifo will be created if target does not exist.
; raw_target = /dev/stdout

# Raw data format. Can be 'binary' or 'ascii'.
; data_format = binary

# Binary bit format, can be '8bit' (0-255) or '16bit' (0-65530).
; bit_format = 16bit

# Ascii max value. In 'ascii' mode range will run from 0 to value specified here
; ascii_max_range = 1000

# Ascii delimiters. In ascii format each bar and frame is separated by a delimiters.
# Use decimal value in ascii table (i.e. 59 = ';' and 10 = '\n' (line feed)).
; bar_delimiter = 59
; frame_delimiter = 10

# sdl window size and position. -1,-1 is centered.
; sdl_width = 1000
; sdl_height = 500
; sdl_x = -1
; sdl_y= -1

[color]

# Colors can be one of seven predefined: black, blue, cyan, green, magenta, red, white, yellow.
# Or defined by hex code '#xxxxxx' (hex code must be within ''). User defined colors requires
# ncurses output method and a terminal that can change color definitions such as Gnome-terminal or rxvt.
# if supported, ncurses mode will be forced on if user defined colors are used.
# default is to keep current terminal color
; background = default
; foreground = default

# SDL only support hex code colors, these are the default:
; background = '#111111'
; foreground = '#33cccc'


# Gradient mode, only hex defined colors (and thereby ncurses mode) are supported,
# background must also be defined in hex  or remain commented out. 1 = on, 0 = off.
# You can define as many as 8 different colors. They range from bottom to top of screen
# In the [color] section

[color]

gradient = 1

gradient_color_1 = '#%%color8.hex%%'
gradient_color_2 = '#%%color9.hex%%'
gradient_color_3 = '#%%color3.hex%%'
gradient_color_4 = '#%%color4.hex%%'
gradient_color_5 = '#%%color5.hex%%'
gradient_color_6 = '#%%color6.hex%%'
gradient_color_7 = '#%%color13.hex%%'
gradient_color_8 = '#%%color7.hex%%'



[smoothing]

# Percentage value for integral smoothing. Takes values from 0 - 100.
# Higher values means smoother, but less precise. 0 to disable.
; integral = 77

# Disables or enables the so-called "Monstercat smoothing" with or without "waves". Set to 0 to disable.
; monstercat = 0
; waves = 0

# Set gravity percentage for "drop off". Higher values means bars will drop faster.
# Accepts only non-negative values. 50 means half gravity, 200 means double. Set to 0 to disable "drop off".
; gravity = 100


# In bar height, bars that would have been lower that this will not be drawn.
; ignore = 0


[eq]

# This one is tricky. You can have as much keys as you want.
# Remember to uncomment more then one key! More keys = more precision.
# Look at readme.md on github for further explanations and examples.
; 1 = 1 # bass
; 2 = 1
; 3 = 1 # midtone
; 4 = 1
; 5 = 1 # treble
```

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that fixes the template parsing issue with the cava configuration file
An explanation of what causes the parsing error in the cava config template

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:20.04

# Set non-interactive mode for apt
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Add metadata
LABEL maintainer="Docker Builder"
LABEL description="Environment for validating the cava config template parsing issue in hellwal"
LABEL version="1.0"

# Update system and install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    build-essential \
    git \
    make \
    gcc \
    libc6-dev \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/danihek/hellwal.git . \
    && git checkout 44c8c1c4e650ea8b76f4be633b9bfc56e23c80e0

# Build the project
RUN make

# Create a directory for user to mount their images
RUN mkdir -p /images

# Create a volume for persistent cache
VOLUME /root/.cache/hellwal

# Set the default command to show help
CMD ["./hellwal", "--help"]

border=%%border%%

author: MalcolmReed-ent

comments.body:
I've addressed the issue through a pull request, improving both hellwal.c and the Makefile for smoother compilation. Feel free to close this at your convenience. 

However, I have a few questions about the project:
1. Is it expected behavior for only one terminal to change color when running hellwal? I've noticed that in ST, only the terminal where I execute the command changes, while other open terminals and newly launched ones don't adopt the new colorscheme.
2. Should I add a hellwal command to my .xinitrc file to ensure it runs on system startup?
3. What other applications can benefit from hellwal? Would DWM or various X11 programs be compatible with it?

Hi, thank you for creating an issue and PR!

1. Hellwal should color all **currently** open terminals. If you want to have colored every new opened terminal, you have to create template file with colors and source it in ``.bashrc``. I've done it like this:

(these two hellwal templates are in repo in ``./templates`` folder)
```sh
dh Â» pwd
/home/dh/.config/hellwal
dh Â» tree
.
â”œâ”€â”€ templates
â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ terminal.sh
â”‚Â Â  â””â”€â”€ variables.sh
```

And in the end of your bashrc put this:

```sh
source ~/.cache/hellwal/variables.sh
sh ~/.cache/hellwal/terminal.sh
``` 

2. You don't have to, after running hellwal it's saved to ``~/.cache``, you just have to somehow source or load generated files.
3. A lot, probably anything that can be set through some config file. I use hellwal for Firefox, Terminals, Discord, Duckduckgo, Hyprland, HellWM, Waybar.... There is a lot.

PS: I already merged **PR**, thank you :) 

Anything else would you like to know about Hellwal or how to use it?

I get it now, it will take you as far as your scripting will, if i make a script specifying the colors for dwm or st or dmenu it will change according, i get it now, i just thought it was somewhat folder rich of scripts like pywal.
also, if it wouldnt be a physical undertaking could you possibly make a dwm and dmenu script so it can change the colorschemes also since ST already work.

Guidance on how to apply color schemes to multiple terminals

Understanding of hellwal's template-based approach to theming

title: hw/rdc_setup.sh: fix typos, add missing files
body:
This PR contains the changes that I found necessary for building the project for the Tofino reference platforms.

Apart from some obvious typos and missing directories for source and header files, it appears to me that the `libavago` pre-built binaries need to be copied as well.
author: alexandergall

comments.body: @vgurevich @pkotikal Would one of you be able to try this out?  I do not think Fabian has access to the proprietary Intel software to try this out, and I do not.

@jafingerhut -- I do not have access to Tofino HW at the moment. But I'd trust @alexandergall :) I was also surprised seeing the `avago` directory missing in the original code, so this makes sense to me for sure.

> @jafingerhut -- I do not have access to Tofino HW at the moment. But I'd trust @alexandergall :) I was also surprised seeing the `avago` directory missing in the original code, so this makes sense to me for sure.

I was mainly thinking of trying out the script with the mix of open-p4studio and proprietary Intel software to see if the script runs without error.  Testing it on hardware afterwards is of course ideal, but verifying that the script actually runs for one more person other than the one who wrote it is a far better check than only the one person who wrote it.

If that isn't possible, no worries.  Just hoping for at least a _little bit_ of testing or review on this.
@ansamalintel, can you please look into this?

@jafingerhut -- I decided to give it a try, but one thing I can see right away is that the instructions in the `README.md` are kinda incomplete and the script will require further enhancements for usability. Let me try to build the way I think it **should** work and we'll see what will happen.

I followed the instructions the best I could, specifically:

1. Extracted the contents of the SDE package `bf-drivers-9.13.3` into `/tmp` (that's the step that seems to be missing in the` README.md`)

```bash
cd /tmp
tar xzvf ~/bf-sde-9.13.3/packages/bf-drivers-9.13.3.tgz
```

2. Edited the file `~/op4-rdc/open-p4studio/hw/rdc.setup.sh` as described, specifically:

```bash
RDC_BFD="/tmp/bf-drivers-9.13.3"
OS_BFD="/home/ubuntu/op4-rdc/open-p4studio/pkgsrc/bf-drivers"
```

3. Copied the files using the procedure, described in `README.md`, specifically:

```bash
source rdc_setup.sh
rdc_setup
```

The copying went well, without any error messages:

```bash
ubuntu@ip-172-31-32-12:~/op4-rdc/open-p4studio/hw$ source rdc_setup.sh 
ubuntu@ip-172-31-32-12:~/op4-rdc/open-p4studio/hw$ rdc_setup 
Copying src/alphawave
Copying src/credo
Copying src/avago
Copying src/microp
Copying include/avago/aapl.h
Copying include/avago/avago_aapl.h
Copying include/avago/avago_dox.h
Copying src/port_mgr/csr
Copying src/port_mgr/crdo
Copying src/port_mgr/aw-gen
Copying src/port_mgr/t3-csr
Copying src/port_mgr/CMakeLists.txt
Copying src/port_mgr/bf_ll_umac3_if.c
Copying src/port_mgr/bf_ll_umac4_if.c

Copying src/port_mgr/port_mgr_physical_dev.h
Copying src/port_mgr/port_mgr_umac_access.c
Copying src/port_mgr/port_mgr_tof1/bf_serdes_if.c
Copying src/port_mgr/port_mgr_tof1/comira_reg_access_autogen.c
Copying src/port_mgr/port_mgr_tof1/comira_reg_access_autogen.h

Many thanks for trying it out, Vlad, and the detailed feedback.  Hopefully Alexander can determine what changes to the PR might help.

@alexdandergall I am not sure if you signed your git commit, e.g. using `git commit -s <additional options>`, but something like that is required in this and other p4lang repositories in order to pass the DCO check.  I see the DCO check "pending", not "failed", which I have not seen before, so if you already did that, hopefully the next commit the check will pass smoothly.

Just to summarize my review:

1. The proposed changes are correct and necessary to get the patching going. The current `hw/rdc_setup.sh` script does not seem to be correct in the first place. Since this is the title of the pull request, I think it can be approved, since that's exactly what it does. 
2. Despite those changes, there are at least two more issues with the `p4studio` tool that prevent the actual build for the HW from happening. I am fairly certain that they are not related to the changes in this PR and have been there from the very beginning (@pkotikal -- was that tested in the first place)? W can file them separately and work on them in the due course.
3. We can also file an enhancement request for the `hw/rdc_setup.sh` script, where instead of requiring the user to manually untar the official (RDC) SDE release and then untarring the package and then necessitating editing the paths it will do all that automatically.

I should have mentioned that I used my own build system to test this patch. That's why I didn't notice  the issue with the `p4studio` tool. If we agree that the patch as such is correct I would be in favor of tracking the problem with the setup tool separately.
I have approved the change. In the mean time, I will review the script after comparing the open source repo with internal repo.

> Just to summarize my review:
> 
> 1. The proposed changes are correct and necessary to get the patching going. The current `hw/rdc_setup.sh` script does not seem to be correct in the first place. Since this is the title of the pull request, I think it can be approved, since that's exactly what it does.
> 2. Despite those changes, there are at least two more issues with the `p4studio` tool that prevent the actual build for the HW from happening. I am fairly certain that they are not related to the changes in this PR and have been there from the very beginning (@pkotikal -- was that tested in the first place)? W can file them separately and work on them in the due course.
> 3. We can also file an enhancement request for the `hw/rdc_setup.sh` script, where instead of requiring the user to manually untar the official (RDC) SDE release and then untarring the package and then necessitating editing the paths it will do all that automatically.

This PR has been approved, and I do not personally know of a reason to delay merging it.

If it is merged in its current form, it would be great if we could track your items 2 and 3 above as separate issues.

satisfaction_conditions: Correct file paths for copying proprietary files from Intel's SDE package
Inclusion of the libavago pre-built binaries
A script that runs without file copy errors when executed
Fixes to typos in the original script
Compatibility with the Tofino reference platform build process

title: Failed to resolve app state
body:
Hi there, 

Thanks for creating this UI, I am excited to try it out!

I was able to get it working earlier, but I am now hit with an error whenever I run `duckdb -ui`: 
```
Failed to resolve app state with user - Error: Binder Error: Catalog "_duckdb_ui" does not exist!
User ID: unknown
User E-mail: unknown
```

Is this a known thing? 

Kind regards, 
Daniel
author: Dtenwolde

comments.body:
Hi @Dtenwolde this is possibly because you have an outdated extension. 
Can you try to run `UPDATE EXTENSIONS` or `FORCE INSTALL ui` and be sure you have the latest version, `963e0e4`?

Let me know if it helps.
That worked, thank you!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that resolves the 'Failed to resolve app state' error
Instructions for updating or reinstalling the UI extension
A quick, executable fix that doesn't require complex troubleshooting

title: Deep copy a VectorSchemaRoot?
author: tisonkun

comments.body: You should use VectorLoader/VectorUnloader to "move" the contents of the reader's root into your own

That is the intended usage. What is the problem?

(Note that you can also just keep an array of the batches from the unloader, and load/stream them through a root as necessary.)
OK thanks. Yes it seems a list of ArrowRecordBatch owns the buffer and doesn't need to tune with the lifecycle of allocator.
Emmm .. No. The ArrowRecordBatch's buffer is still bound to the allocator, and it doesn't have the schema info where we need to store elsewhere.

Yes, there isn't really any way of untying things from an allocator (this is intentional). There are APIs to transfer memory between allocators (or you can just keep a single allocator across different contexts).

@lidavidm Thanks for your information! Is there some docs/cookbook for copy VectorSchemaRoot? It seems challenging to ensure the lifetime of both data and allocator are aligned and I suppose some demo code would help a lot.

satisfaction_conditions: Clear guidance on the proper way to copy a VectorSchemaRoot
Information about memory management and allocator lifecycle
Code examples showing proper resource handling
Documentation or cookbook references for common Arrow operations

title: uni-meter does not work when at startup the mqtt input device was not available

- stop uni-meter
- stop Home Assistant and with it the HA MQTT broker, which is input-source of uni-meter

title: Brave search mcp server error: fetch is not defined
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have configured the brave search mcp server on my mac, but when Claude tried to used got **Error: fetch is not defined**

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Configure the brave search mcp server like this
"brave-search": {
        "command": "npx",
        "args": [
          "-y",
          "@modelcontextprotocol/server-brave-search"
        ],
        "env": {
          "BRAVE_API_KEY": "BSASaoHXXXXXXXXXXXX"
        }
      }
2. Restart Claude Desktop app
3. look for the MCP available tools
4. got the brave_web_search tools listed
5. ask about something like: look something about steve jobs 
6. Claude tried to do
{
  `count`: 5,
  `query`: `Steve Jobs biography achievements Apple history`
}

**Expected behavior**
To use the results from the brave search API

**Logs**
If applicable, add logs to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
My current Claude Desktop version is Version 0.7.5 (0.7.5)
author: juanmacedan1co

comments.body:
the fix was to include the correct node version in the ENV 
PATH=/Users/username/.nvm/versions/node/v20.18.0/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that resolves the 'fetch is not defined' error when using Brave search MCP server
A proper Node.js environment configuration for the MCP server
Clear instructions for modifying the Claude Desktop configuration
A working integration between Claude Desktop and Brave search functionality

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM node:20-slim

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Install necessary tools
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y git && \
    apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Clone the repository and checkout specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers.git . && \
    git checkout 1c30f54b2dd27f50003a9b1f85c4fce93c09b08d

# Install dependencies for brave-search server
WORKDIR /app/src/brave-search

# Install dependencies and build the project
RUN npm ci && \
    npm run build

# Set environment variables (user will need to provide their own API key)
ENV BRAVE_API_KEY=""

# Set working directory back to the project root
WORKDIR /app

# Comment explaining the issue and solution
# This Dockerfile sets up an environment to address the "fetch is not defined" error
# in the brave search MCP server. The issue is likely due to a missing polyfill 
# in the Node.js environment. Building the project from the specific commit ensures
# we're working with the version that exhibits the issue.

title: Can multiple proxies run on 1 usertoken?
body:
I have a question: if a userToken has one nodeId and one hardwareId, can it run multiple proxies? Will it receive multiple rewards?
Or can each userToken, nodeId, and hardwareId only run on one proxy?

Thanks for reading. I look forward to your reply.
author: lenhu96

comments.body: 1 nodeid is only can run 1 process, so you can't run 1 nodeid with multiple proxies. But usertoken can run multiple different nodeid (5 max)

Thank you for sharing.
But I noticed in the config.js file, there is a format like the one below:

javascript
Copy code
usertoken: 'usertoken1',
nodes: [
    { nodeId: 'nodeid1', hardwareId: 'hardwareid1', proxy: 'proxy1' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid2', hardwareId: 'hardwareid2', proxy: 'proxy2' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid3', hardwareId: 'hardwareid3', proxy: 'proxy3' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid4', hardwareId: 'hardwareid4', proxy: 'proxy4' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid5', hardwareId: 'hardwareid5', proxy: 'proxy5' }
]
From this, I see that on the same PC, if there are 2 browsers, there will be 2 userTokens and 2 nodeIds but the same hardwareId.
So, in what situation would there be a case like the format you shared, where one userToken has multiple nodeIds?

I hope you understand as I still donâ€™t fully grasp it.
Looking forward to your response.

Thank you very much.

You only need one usertoken for one account, each time you login the account in the different browser or device you will have a different usertoken, just copy one. For nodeid, each extension installation will have a different nodeid and hardwareid comes from the hardware identification of your device, you will need to install extension in different device to have different hardwareid.

I got it
Awesome
Thanks for sharing
Love you <3

satisfaction_conditions: Clear explanation of the relationship between usertoken, nodeId, and hardwareId
Clarification on the maximum number of proxies that can be run with a single configuration
Explanation of how the config.js file structure relates to real-world usage
Information about how hardware identification works across different devices

title: Stale file_path metadata
body:
I moved some folders, and while the preview images refreshed, the file_path in the metadata.json files did not, so none of those loras can be loaded in the LoraManager Lora Loader anymore. Can you either deduce the file_path each time or update it on refresh? Thanks!

ps. Love the component! +1 to the lora_stack and /models endpt feature requests.
author: broken

comments.body: Thanks for the feedback! When you say "moved some folders," do you mean you manually moved them in the file explorer?
Yes. That's what I mean.

I wouldn't recommend manually moving folders at this time. The watchdog monitors additions and deletions within loras_root, but when files are moved manually, it only detects new additionsâ€”not deletions. Plus due to the unpredictable order of multiple file moves (e.g., the LoRA file moving before its metadata file), cache inconsistencies or even metadata loss may occur.

If I have time, Iâ€™ll look into a more sophisticated solution to handle this better. For now, I recommend using the bulk operation feature in LoRA Manager to move files within the interface safely.

That said, I've submitted a fix that will attempt to correct incorrect file paths when rebuilding the cache on startup. If you're experiencing issues where metadata errors prevent LoRAs from loading, please try restarting ComfyUI and see if that resolves the problem.

Also, LoRA Stack is already supported in v0.7.36, and checkpoint management is planned for a future update.

Yeah, I noticed that behavior with the monitor.

I'm away atm, but will test this change and the lora stacks when I get back home in a few days. Thanks!
Confirming this was fixed. Thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that addresses the mismatch between moved files and their metadata paths
A way to maintain consistency between actual file locations and their recorded paths in metadata
Support for LoRA stacks functionality
Clear guidance on proper file management practices within the system

Failed to construct 'WebSocket': An insecure WebSocket connection may not be initiated from a page loaded over HTTPS.

title: Japanese language not working properly
body: When selecting "j" as language code and a Japanese voice, it only creates a very short audio with unrecognizable utterance. The produced phonemes are correct though, and other languages such as English work fine.
author: kaieberl

comments.body:
Do you have the latest versions of `kokoro` and `misaki` both at 0.8.2? You can `pip show kokoro misaki` to check.

I just ran this code in Google Colab and got audio:
```py
!pip install -q kokoro>=0.8.2 soundfile
!apt-get -qq -y install espeak-ng > /dev/null 2>&1
!pip install "misaki[ja]>=0.8.2"

from kokoro import KPipeline
from IPython.display import display, Audio
import soundfile as sf
import torch
pipeline = KPipeline(lang_code='j')
text = 'ã€Œã‚‚ã—ãŠã‚ŒãŒãŸã å¶ç„¶ã€ãã—ã¦ã“ã†ã—ã‚ˆã†ã¨ã„ã†ã¤ã‚‚ã‚Šã§ãªãã“ã“ã«ç«‹ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ãªã‚‰ã€ã¡ã‚‡ã£ã¨ã°ã‹ã‚Šçµ¶æœ›ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚ã ãªã€ã¨ã€ãã‚“ãªã“ã¨ãŒå½¼ã®é ­ã«æ€ã„æµ®ã‹ã‚“ã ã€‚'

generator = pipeline(
    text, voice='jf_alpha',
    speed=1, split_pattern=r'\n+'
)

for i, (gs, ps, audio) in enumerate(generator):
    print(i)  # i => index
    print(gs) # gs => graphemes/text
    print(ps) # ps => phonemes
    display(Audio(data=audio, rate=24000, autoplay=i==0))
    sf.write(f'{i}.wav', audio, 24000) # save each audio file
```

Thank you for the quick reply!
I just tried again with Python 3.11 and it worked, so probably there is no pip version for 3.9

satisfaction_conditions: A working solution for Japanese language audio generation
Information about compatibility requirements or dependencies
A way to verify correct installation and configuration

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM python:3.10-slim

# Set up environment variables
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 \
    PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1 \
    PIP_NO_CACHE_DIR=1 \
    PIP_DISABLE_PIP_VERSION_CHECK=1

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    git \
    build-essential \
    espeak-ng \
    mecab \
    libmecab-dev \
    mecab-ipadic-utf8 \
    unidic-mecab \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/hexgrad/kokoro.git . \
    && git checkout b15ef354b2db4de4654fb521b52908c1c2d79c7e

# Install Python dependencies with optimizations for faster build
RUN pip install --upgrade pip \
    && pip install -e . \
    && pip install misaki[ja] torch soundfile

# Set up Japanese language support
ENV PYTHONIOENCODING=utf-8 \
    LANG=C.UTF-8 \
    LC_ALL=C.UTF-8

# The project is now built and ready for testing Japanese language functionality
CMD ["python", "-c", "print('Kokoro is ready for use with Japanese language support')"]

title: results option is being ignored by journeys function
body:
## expected:

when calling the `journeys` function with the `results: 1` option, I expected the max number of results to be 1.

## actual:

```
 let data = await client.journeys(berlinJungfernheide, mÃ¼nchenHbf, {
        results: 1,
        tickets: true,
 })
```

returns more than one journey:

```
{
  earlierRef: '3|OB|MTÂµ14Âµ541001Âµ541001Âµ541272Âµ541272Âµ0Âµ0Âµ485Âµ540980Âµ1Âµ0Âµ26Âµ0Âµ0Âµ-2147483648Âµ1Âµ2|PDHÂµ5cad74a0d15ed317fb4ba0dde7ed8b36|RDÂµ17122024|RTÂµ162300|USÂµ0|RSÂµINIT',
  laterRef: '3|OF|MTÂµ14Âµ541180Âµ541180Âµ541441Âµ541441Âµ0Âµ0Âµ485Âµ541122Âµ5Âµ0Âµ26Âµ0Âµ0Âµ-2147483648Âµ1Âµ2|PDHÂµ5cad74a0d15ed317fb4ba0dde7ed8b36|RDÂµ17122024|RTÂµ162300|USÂµ0|RSÂµINIT',
  journeys: [
    [Object], [Object],
    [Object], [Object],
    [Object], [Object],
    [Object]
  ],
  realtimeDataUpdatedAt: null
}
```
author: grssnbchr

comments.body:
Yes, the new backend API does unfortunately not allow specifying the number of desired results. There are quite a few parameters like that that are not known to exist in the new API or I that was too lazy to implement so far (see `TODO`s scattered across the code).
The journey list is now truncated if `results` is set, however, you will not be able to increase the number of returned results (use `laterThan` with additional requests for that).
Got it, thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: An explanation of why the 'results' parameter doesn't limit results as expected
Information about current behavior of the 'results' parameter
Alternative approaches to achieve the desired functionality

title: Cannot remove plates from Known Plates Dashboard

Running on Linux Docker with the latest repo changes.

Clicking on the delete button within the table of known plates doesn't delete the plate.

comments.body:
Thank you. Fix pushed. 

`docker compose down`, then `docker compose up -d` should fix. If not, `docker pull algertc/alpr-dashboard` and that should pull the latest version.

pulling the new image got it to work. Known plates are being removed correctly now.

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that fixes the 'removeFromKnownPlates is not defined' error
Clear instructions on how to apply the fix to their Docker environment

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM node:18-bullseye AS builder

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout specific commit
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git && \
    git clone https://github.com/algertc/ALPR-Database.git . && \
    git checkout 95ee6d78b3c5f4466defc24c9212c6596125261b

# Copy package files and install dependencies
# Force the install to proceed despite errors
RUN npm install --legacy-peer-deps

# Build the application
RUN npm run build

# Create the production image
FROM node:18-bullseye

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Copy built assets and dependencies from builder stage
COPY --from=builder /app/.next ./.next
COPY --from=builder /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
COPY --from=builder /app/package.json ./package.json
COPY --from=builder /app/next.config.js ./next.config.js

# Create config and auth directories to persist data
RUN mkdir -p /app/config /app/auth
VOLUME ["/app/config", "/app/auth"]

# Copy specific files needed for runtime
COPY --from=builder /app/schema.sql ./schema.sql
COPY --from=builder /app/lib ./lib
COPY --from=builder /app/middleware.js ./middleware.js
COPY --from=builder /app/app ./app
COPY --from=builder /app/components ./components
COPY --from=builder /app/hooks ./hooks

# Expose the application port
EXPOSE 3000

# Set environment variables
ENV NODE_ENV=production

# Command to run the application
CMD ["npm", "start"]

title: Non-desired tags when plugin is installled on several PC with synced database
body:
Hi
I use Zotero on several Pcs, on which I installed attachment-scanner. My database in synchronized.
It seems that a scan has been operated quickly after the plugin installation (I installed the plugin at the very opening of application)  : non-desired tags  (all three categories and with default simpole format) appeared since I had scanned previously on another PC with non-default options. I guess this scan is triggered by the monitoring option which is set as on by default. If so and if I'm not wrong perhaps would it be more secure to set it as off by default ?
This is not a great problem since tags can be easily removed.
Best regards
Yves
author: ynedelec3

comments.body: The default is changed to off in v0.3.0. Thanks!
Great, thanks

title: Reloading application.css when constituent files are changed (Sprockets)
body:
Thanks for making this! :star_struck: We're still running sprockets, so it was nice to see #41 adding basic sprockets support â€“ thanks for that @codergeek121!

I was still struggling to make it work, and have had to make some modifications to get to a walking skeleton of CSS reloading:

1. Add some subfolders of `app/assets/stylesheets` to `css_paths`
1. Add `scss` to `css_extensions`
1. Monkey patch `Hotwire::Spark::Change#canonical_changed_path` to always return "/application.css" when `action == :reload_css`.

The first two points was necessary for any events to get fired in the first place, as my CSS is mainly defined in scss files in subfolders of `app/assets/stylesheets`, imported in `app/assets/stylesheets/application.scss`. Part 3 was to get `application.css` reloaded, in stead of the constituent file that was actually modified.

Is there something I've misunderstood here? If not, perhaps some additions could be made to streamline this a bit :thinking:
author: rogerkk

comments.body:
I don't think you misunderstood! Currently, there's only basic support for Sprockets, meaning it simply doesn't raise an error if you're using Sprockets. There's no support for sass/scss/coffeescript right now. I think this would also be kind of hard to add in a non-buggy way, without parsing sass imports.

If you don't want to monkey patch, you could also try the following instead:

1. Change the reload method to `:replace`, since this will also reload the `<head>` if there are changes
2. Add the `scss` extension and paths to the **html_paths** and **html_extensions**, which will then trigger an `:replace` reload if a `scss` file is changed

This will not do a fine-grained css reload, but a full Turbo visit instead, but maybe this is good enough for your use case.
Ah, nice to know about an alternative approach. The monkey patching is working at the moment, but now I have somewhere to go if/when it causes me too much pain. :sweat_smile:  Thanks again!
Thanks for the help here @codergeek121

satisfaction_conditions: A solution for reloading application.css when constituent SCSS files in subfolders are changed
An explanation of the current limitations of Sprockets support in the library
A workable alternative to monkey patching for handling SCSS file changes
Clear technical guidance that acknowledges the user's current approach while offering alternatives

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM nvidia/cuda:12.1.1-cudnn8-devel-ubuntu22.04

# Set environment variables
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PATH="/usr/local/cuda/bin:${PATH}"
ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/cuda/lib64:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}"

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    git \
    wget \
    curl \
    python3-dev \
    python3-pip \
    ffmpeg \
    libsm6 \
    libxext6 \
    libgl1-mesa-glx \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository at the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/Wan-Video/Wan2.1.git /app && \
    cd /app && \
    git checkout a326079926a4a347ecda8863dc40ba2d7680a294

# Upgrade pip and install PyTorch 2.4.0 with CUDA support first
RUN pip3 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade pip && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir torch>=2.4.0 torchvision>=0.17.0 --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121

# Install project dependencies in batches to improve build reliability
RUN pip3 install --no-cache-dir numpy scipy matplotlib && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir opencv-python pillow && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir tqdm transformers einops && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir huggingface_hub modelscope && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt

# Create model and output directories
RUN mkdir -p /models /output

# Fix for the Float to Byte casting error in cache_video
# Modify the code to handle the type conversion properly
RUN sed -i 's/np.array(frames)/np.array(frames, dtype=np.uint8)/g' wan/utils/utils.py

# Set environment variables for better performance
ENV OMP_NUM_THREADS=1
ENV PYTORCH_CUDA_ALLOC_CONF=max_split_size_mb:128

# Set up a volume for models and output
VOLUME ["/models", "/output"]

# Set the working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Example usage:
# docker run --gpus all -v /path/to/models:/models -v /path/to/output:/output wan2-1-image \
#   python generate.py --task t2v-1.3B --size 480*832 --ckpt_dir /models/Wan2.1-T2V-1.3B \
#   --prompt "your prompt here" --save_file /output/output.mp4

dockerfile:
FROM nvidia/cuda:12.1.1-cudnn8-devel-ubuntu22.04

# Set environment variables
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PATH="/usr/local/cuda/bin:${PATH}"
ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/cuda/lib64:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}"

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    git \
    wget \
    curl \
    python3-dev \
    python3-pip \
    ffmpeg \
    libsm6 \
    libxext6 \
    libgl1-mesa-glx \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository at the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/Wan-Video/Wan2.1.git /app && \
    cd /app && \
    git checkout 73648654c5242bd8e11bd05ea36ffa87a6424ff6

# Upgrade pip and install PyTorch 2.4.0 with CUDA support first
RUN pip3 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade pip && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir torch>=2.4.0 torchvision>=0.17.0 --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121

# Fix for Issue #50: Prevent automatic download of Qwen2.5-14B-Instruct model
# Create a modified requirements.txt file without the Qwen model dependency
RUN grep -v "qwen" requirements.txt > requirements_modified.txt || true

# Install project dependencies in batches to improve build reliability
RUN pip3 install --no-cache-dir numpy scipy matplotlib && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir opencv-python pillow && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir tqdm transformers einops && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir huggingface_hub modelscope && \
    pip3 install --no-cache-dir -r requirements_modified.txt

# Create model directories for user to mount models
RUN mkdir -p /models/Wan2.1-T2V-1.3B /models/Wan2.1-T2V-14B /models/Wan2.1-I2V-14B-480P /models/Wan2.1-I2V-14B-720P

# Set environment variables for better performance
ENV OMP_NUM_THREADS=1
ENV PYTORCH_CUDA_ALLOC_CONF=max_split_size_mb:128

# Set up a volume for models and output
VOLUME ["/models", "/output"]

# Set the working directory
WORKDIR /app

title: about vae causality
body:
Hello, I have two questions regarding the following statement from the paper:

"In terms of architecture, we replace all GroupNorm layers (Wu & He, 2018) with RMSNorm layers (Zhang & Sennrich, 2019) to preserve temporal causality."

What is the motivation behind replacing GroupNorm with RMSNorm?

When RMSNorm performs normalization, it uses statistics from all frames. My understanding is that this does not preserve causality because earlier frames, when being normalized, rely on statistics computed from the entire sequenceâ€”meaning they effectively "see" future frames.
author: bobopit

comments.body: Hello. For a standard GroupNorm(group=g), the mean and variance of the input x (shape [b,c,t,h,w]) are computed as mean=x.view(b, g,-1).mean(); var=x.view(b, g,-1).var(). Thus the statistics of the mean and variance of each frame will involve the entire time dimension and are not causally. Whereas RMSNorm normalizes only along the channel dimension, i.e., x_norm=F.normalize(x, dim=1), the normalization process between different frames is independent, making it causal.

Thank you for your response. I now understand the causality aspect. However, to preserve causality, one could also use GroupNorm2D instead of GroupNorm. What are the advantages of using RMSNorm over GroupNorm2D?
In fact, we tried using GroupNorm2D, but our preliminary experiments show that RMSNorm performs better.

satisfaction_conditions: An explanation of how RMSNorm preserves temporal causality compared to GroupNorm
A comparison of the performance benefits of RMSNorm over alternative causal normalization approaches
Technical details about how normalization is computed across different dimensions

title: Prevent Timeout
body: Hello, quick question, how do you manage the Timeout errors that you encounter when dealing with long answers ?
author: Pekno

comments.body: Each of the builtin tool actions is quick so you never get close to the 60s timeout. This is more of a problem for custom commands which could take a long time to run. I think probably the right way to handle this when we come to it is to run the command asynchronously, block the tool call 55sec or so, and if the async command is not done yet we return and ask the LLM to do another tool call to wait some more.

Maybe my actions are too broad, but I encounter a lot of timeout when juste asking things like "Implement X feature", wich it seems to understand and try to implement, but then after a while just timeout and the conversation closes.
I've experienced random cannot connect to Claude and occasionally cannot connect to codemcp.  I either reload the mcp or restart Claude Desktop, which resolves the issue for a while.
Oh so there is an infinite loop bug on main I need to push a fix for lol. If the logs say "advanced patch apply" before it hangs it's that
I'm also having a similar issue where when codemcp makes a file change, it hangs at doing the write task, even if it completes it.
I just cut a new release with the infinite loop fix. Please give it a try. I'll close this issue in a week or so if no one reports that it's still happening on the newest version.
Everything seems back in order, didn't encounter any timeout for the time being. Will try with more tests tomorow and will close if no issues. Thanks for the quick fix ! And great work for this MCP !

I'm not sure if should open a different issue or not; just because it's sort of related to timeout issues; but even when creating a file for example a simple txt document. the file is created, then it will hang for another ~30 seconds until saying **"I've created a test file named test_file.txt in the %name% directory. The file contains a simple test function that adds two numbers together"**

Is this normal behavior?

If the MCP finished running then further delay is an Anthropic problem. I have noticed this happens sometimes.

Another cause for hang is if something bad happens to codemcp server. Then Claude Desktop is just wedged and you need to restart it.

If you have evidence (eg logs) that it is specifically a codemcp problem I will look more. But a lot of slowness I have noticed in practice is Anthropic
Everything is working as intended, no more Timeout ! Thanks again for the fix !

satisfaction_conditions: A fix for timeout errors when dealing with long answers
Ability to complete complex tasks without the conversation closing prematurely
Stable performance without requiring manual restarts or reloads

title: Unable to make any changes
body:
Hi, 
This is my first attempt using this tool and it's a bit confusing. I created `codemcp.toml` which is empty because I do not need it to do anything except make changes to the files and commit. No run/test etc. However, it keeps saying permission denied even though I selected the "Allow for this chat" prompt when I request a change to my repo. Here's what I see:

```
Now that I've initialized the project, I'll first search for the Streamlit file we need to migrate to Gradio.
{
  `path`: `<path>`,
  `chat_id`: `3-refactor-migrate-ui-from-streamlit-to-gradio`,
  `subtool`: `LS`
}
Error: File is not in a git repository. Permission denied.

Let me try a different approach to find the streamlit file:
{
  `path`: `<path>`,
  `chat_id`: `3-refactor-migrate-ui-from-streamlit-to-gradio`,
  `command`: `find`,
  `subtool`: `RunCommand`,
  `arguments`: `[\"<path>", \"-name\", \"streamlit*\"]`
}
Error: No find command configured in codemcp.toml
and so on. 
```

Do I need to create commands for ls/find etc for it to work? What am I missing?
author: shekhars-li

comments.body:
The second tool use is a red herring, Sonnet is very prone to hallucinating when a tool that should work doesn't.

Did you also init a git repository in your codemcp.toml? This smells like you didn't.

Okay. i spent like 2 hours trying to work this out. as i was having the same issue.

git config --global user.email "" 
git config --global user.name ""

After running these, i was able to write.  Give this a try @shekhars-li
Thanks a lot @notschema. That worked for me! :)
I removed some exception rethrowing which hopefully makes this clearer in the future

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that enables the user to make changes to files in their repository using the tool
Clear instructions for resolving git-related permission issues
A straightforward fix that doesn't require complex configuration of the codemcp.toml file

title: question: why observability/prom-adapter.yaml only handles vllm_num_requests_waiting metric
body:
In the observability/prom-adapter.yaml configuration, why does the rule only match the metric vllm_num_requests_waiting

Current

```
rules:
  custom:
    - seriesQuery: '{__name__=~"^vllm:num_requests_waiting$"}'  # Only matches vllm metric
```

How to determine additional metrics (e.g., gpu_prefix_cache_hit_rate)
author: ZhouBoXiao

comments.body:
Hi @ZhouBoXiao thanks for submitting the issue! 
This observability/prom-adapter.yaml is used as the metrics for a basic version of autoscaling. You may add more metrics to it if you want to use them for more advanced autoscaling.
Thank you, I can add personalized metrics as needed,  not limited in the prom-adapter.yaml

satisfaction_conditions: Clarification on the purpose of the prom-adapter.yaml configuration file
Confirmation that additional custom metrics can be added to the configuration
Understanding the flexibility of the metrics configuration system

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM pytorch/pytorch:2.0.0-cuda11.7-cudnn8-runtime

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    wget \
    ffmpeg \
    libsm6 \
    libxext6 \
    libgl1-mesa-glx \
    python3-dev \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Clone repository and checkout specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/bytedance/LatentSync.git . && \
    git checkout 0c3489c87c53fdc03820def9cf9100c0e81e2964

# Install Python dependencies with specific tensorflow-gpu version first to avoid conflicts
# Install tensorflow with GPU support and avoid the timeout by splitting installations
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir tensorflow==2.10.0 && \
    pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt

# Create directories for checkpoints
RUN mkdir -p checkpoints/whisper checkpoints/auxiliary

# Set environment variables for GPU usage
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app:$PYTHONPATH
ENV CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0
ENV TF_FORCE_GPU_ALLOW_GROWTH=true
ENV TF_GPU_THREAD_MODE=gpu_private

# Create necessary directory structure
RUN mkdir -p checkpoints/whisper checkpoints/auxiliary

# Set lower CPU priority for TensorFlow operations to prevent 100% CPU usage
ENV TF_CPU_PARALLELISM_THREADS=4
ENV OMP_NUM_THREADS=4
ENV MKL_NUM_THREADS=4

title: Some questions about SyncNet evaluation
body: Great job, I would like to know how to reproduce SyncNet's 94% accuracy metric on the HDFF test set
author: OdingdongO

comments.body:
1. Use the data processing pipeline to process HDTF data
2. Run `./eval/eval_syncnet_acc.sh` to calculate the SyncNet accuracy

> 1. Use the data processing pipeline to process HDTF data
> 2. Run `./eval/eval_syncnet_acc.sh` to calculate the SyncNet accuracy

yes, I have noticed this script. In the paper, 'During evaluation, we randomly selected 30 videos from the test set of HDTF or VoxCeleb2', is the 94% accuracy obtained on these 30 videos? Do you have a name list for these 30 videos?

1. 'During evaluation, we randomly selected 30 videos from the test set of HDTF or VoxCeleb2' This line is for U-Net evaluation. Not related to SyncNet evaluation. 
2. In paper section 3.3 discussion: For SyncNet evaluation, we trained it on VoxCeleb2 and test it on HDTF, which is an out-of-distribution setting, so all videos in HDTF can be considered as test test, no need for name list.

> 1. 'During evaluation, we randomly selected 30 videos from the test set of HDTF or VoxCeleb2' This line is for U-Net evaluation. Not related to SyncNet evaluation.
> 2. In paper section 3.3 discussion: For SyncNet evaluation, we trained it on VoxCeleb2 and test it on HDTF, which is an out-of-distribution setting, so all videos in HDTF can be considered as test test, no need for name list.

ok,thank you

satisfaction_conditions: Clarification about which dataset was used for the 94% accuracy metric mentioned in the paper
Explanation of the difference between SyncNet evaluation and U-Net evaluation methodologies
Information about the test dataset composition for reproducing the SyncNet accuracy results

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM python:3.12-slim

# Set environment variable to avoid prompts during installation
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
ENV UV_SYSTEM_PYTHON=1

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    curl \
    make \
    build-essential \
    nodejs \
    npm \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install UV for package management
RUN pip install --upgrade uv

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/huggingface/smolagents.git . \
    && git checkout 5b2882d4117a6d8a5d50a08b7d56aff1c3a25211

# Install the Model Context Protocol CLI tools
RUN npm install -g @modelcontextprotocol/inspector

# Install the package with all dependencies
# Include test and all extras to ensure we have everything needed
RUN uv pip install -e ".[dev,test,all]"

# Install additional dependencies needed for MCP tools
RUN uv pip install uvx

# Set the working directory to be ready for use
WORKDIR /app

# Default command (can be overridden)
CMD ["bash"]

title: [BUG] Cannot execute class method with LocalPythonExecutor
body:
**Describe the bug**
My LLM write the code in OOP style, defined the class and class methods, when try to execute class method it fails

**Code to reproduce the error**
```python
from smolagents import LocalPythonExecutor

agent_name = "Agent"
executor = LocalPythonExecutor(additional_authorized_imports=["json", "os", "urllib.parse", "bs4", "pprint"])
executor.send_variables({"agent_name": agent_name})

code = """
class Hello: 
    def greetings(self, name: str):
         return f"Hello {name}"

obj = Hello()
print(obj.greetings(agent_name))
"""
executor(code)
```

**Error logs (if any)**
```error
InterpreterError: Code execution failed at line 'print(obj.greetings(agent_name))' due to: InterpreterError: It is not permitted to evaluate other functions than the provided tools or functions defined/imported in previous code (tried to execute print).
```

**Expected behavior**
Successfully execute the code

**Packages version:**
`smolagents==1.12.0`

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
author: ZeusFSX

comments.body:
Thanks for reaching out.

Once you created your executor, you need to set the base static tools by calling `send_tools`:
```python
executor.send_tools({})

executor(code)
```
Output:
```python
(None, 'Hello Agent\n', False)
```
Thanks

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that enables class methods to execute successfully with LocalPythonExecutor
Clear instructions on the proper initialization sequence for LocalPythonExecutor
A fix for the 'not permitted to evaluate other functions' error

title: [BUG] Rich markup causes crash during error logging
body:
**Describe the bug**
Rich markup logging interferes with agent output errors when logging to the console.

```python
class AgentError(Exception):
    """Base class for other agent-related exceptions"""

    def __init__(self, message, logger: "AgentLogger"):
        super().__init__(message)
        self.message = message
        logger.log(f"[bold red]{message}[/bold red]", level="ERROR") # --- ISSUE HERE ---

```

This is problematic because it causes continuous crashes and terminates execution.
The issue occurs when message contains Rich markup syntax, such as closing tags.

**Code to reproduce the error**
```python
from smolagents import CodeAgent, DuckDuckGoSearchTool, HfApiModel

model = HfApiModel()
agent = CodeAgent(tools=[DuckDuckGoSearchTool()], model=model)
agent.run("You have to print this: ^arn:(aws).*:(s3|s3-object-lambda):[a-z\-0-9]*:[0-9]{12}:accesspoint[/:]")
```


**Error logs (if any)**
```bash
  File "/Users/someone/.pyenv/versions/3.11.10/envs/fancy-project/lib/python3.11/site-packages/rich/markup.py", line 167, in render
    raise MarkupError(
rich.errors.MarkupError: closing tag '[/:]' at position 99 doesn't match any open tag
```

**Expected behavior**
It should log error as usual without crashing.

**Packages version:**
`smolagents==1.9.2`

**Additional context**

Debugging, this is an example of the content of `{message}` that is generating the issue.
```bash

a-zA-Z0-9\-]{1,63}$"
Error listing files in S3 bucket mybucket/source: Parameter validation failed:
Invalid bucket name "mybucket/source": Bucket name must match the regex "^[a-zA-Z0-9.\-_]{1,255}$" or be an ARN matching the regex 
"^arn:(aws).*:(s3|s3-object-lambda):[a-z\-0-9]*:[0-9]{12}:accesspoint[/:][a-zA-Z0-9\-.]{1,63}$|^arn:(aws).*:s3-outposts:[a-z\-0-9]+:[0-9]{12}:outpost[/:][a-zA-Z0-9\-]{1,63}[/:]accesspoint[/:][
a-zA-Z0-9\-]{1,63}$"
```

Ability to log error messages containing special characters without application termination
Information about when the fix will be available in a released version

title: Fix duplicate Tool Issue in Open Deep Research
body:
This PR fixes the following error when running Open Deep Research:
`ValueError: Each tool or managed_agent should have a unique name! You passed these duplicate names: ['inspect_file_as_text', 'inspect_file_as_text']`
author: keetrap

comments.body:
Currently, we are passing the `SERPAPI_API_KEY`  in the `BROWSER_CONFIG` as follows:

```python
BROWSER_CONFIG = {
    "viewport_size": 1024 * 5,
    "downloads_folder": "downloads_folder",
    "request_kwargs": {
        "headers": {"User-Agent": user_agent},
        "timeout": 300,
    },
    "serpapi_key": os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY"),
}
```
However, in the `WEB_TOOLS`, the` GoogleSearchTool` is using the `serper` provider, which requires the `SERPER_API_KEY`:
```python 
GoogleSearchTool(provider="serper")
```

This requires users to provide two different API keys. Is this intentional, or should we be using the same provider throughout?

Simple Fix:
```python 
GoogleSearchTool(provider="serpapi")
```

@keetrap initializing these agents should not create a duplicate: since one of the `inspect_file_as_text` belongs to the managed agent and the other belongs to the manager, there's no risk of confusion. We need to change this in the smolagents code.
Closing this due to #796

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that prevents duplicate tool name errors between managed agents and their tools
Proper validation logic that distinguishes between global tool names and tool names within managed agents
Clear error messages that identify the specific duplicate names causing validation failures

title: fix: support o1
body: Remove `max_tokens` for `o1` models
author: ricklamers

comments.body: I couldn't get it working without these changes. Maybe this needs to be changed, but this is working for me.
This fix is not needed anymore! Now that we've removed the default parameter `max_tokens`, the model works out of the box for me. Tell us if you still have errors and we'll reopen!
Nice!

satisfaction_conditions: A working solution for using o1 models without parameter conflicts
Elimination of the need for manual parameter adjustments when using o1 models

title: Always getting the error: "AssertionError exception: no description"
body:
No matter what I do to modify the docstring I always get the same error as mentioned in the title.

Here is a tool that I have created.

I would like to know what within my docstrings is causing this.

```python

cg = CoinGeckoAPI(demo_api_key=os.getenv('coingecko_api_key'))

@tool
def get_coins_list(currency: str) -> list:
    """
    This tool makes a query to the CoinGecko API to get a response of ALL of the supported coins with their price, market cap, volume and related market data in USD.

    Args:
        currency: The dollar value which the coin should be represented into
    """
    return cg.get_coins_markets(vs_currency=currency)

```
author: jondoescoding

comments.body:
Got the same error.

```python
Exception has occurred: AssertionError
exception: no description

Exception has occurred: AssertionError
exception: no description
  File "...\coingecko_agent\agent.py", line 7, in <module>
    coin_list_tool = GetCoinsListTool()
                     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AssertionError: 

```

I don't know if this is suitable for you, but here's what I did:
```python
from smolagents import CodeAgent, HfApiModel, Tool
import os
from pycoingecko import CoinGeckoAPI
import json

# Initialize CoinGecko API client
cg = CoinGeckoAPI(api_key=os.getenv('coingecko_api_key'))

# Define the GetCoinsListTool class
class GetCoinsListTool(Tool):
    name = "get_coins_list"
    description = """
    This tool makes a query to the CoinGecko API to get a response of ALL of the supported coins with their price, market cap, volume and related market data in USD.
    You need to import json. The output is a JSON string. You should use the `json` module to parse this string into a Python list.
    """
    inputs = {
        "currency": {
            "type": "string",
            "description": "The currency in which the coin data should be represented (e.g., 'usd', 'eur')."
        }
    }
    output_type = "string"  # Change to 'string'

    def forward(self, currency: str) -> str:
        coins_data = cg.get_coins_markets(vs_currency=currency)
        return json.dumps(coins_data)  # Convert the list to a JSON string

# Initialize the model
model = HfApiModel(model_id="Qwen/Qwen2.5-Coder-32B-Instruct")

# Initialize the agent with the tool
agent = CodeAgent(
    tools=[GetCoinsListTool()],
    model=model,
    add_base_tools=True,
    additional_authorized_imports=["json"]  # Authorize the json module
)

# Run the agent with a task
task = "Get the list of coins in USD and print the first 5 entries. Then present it as usual text."
result = agent.run(task)

# Print the result
print("Agent Output:")
print(result)
```
Works like a charm. Thanks! But why does the the @tool decorator not work?
@jondoescoding could you provide your full error trace and package versions? I tried to reproduce but for me your code snippet works

satisfaction_conditions: A working solution that resolves the 'AssertionError: no description' error
A functional way to create a CoinGecko API tool that can be used with their agent

title: Code Agent -> max_iterations
body: CodeAgent stops after 5 iterations. Any way to explicitely increase this limit ?
author: flaming-potato

comments.body:
Yes, the CodeAgent class' parent MultiStepAgent has a max_steps parameter that you can change.

`agent = CodeAgent(tools=[DuckDuckGoSearchTool(), PythonInterpreterTool()], model=HfApiModel(), max_steps=20)`
Closing this since @paulmartrencharpro explained the resolution very well! ğŸ˜„
Thanks a lot :)

satisfaction_conditions: Information on how to increase the iteration limit for CodeAgent
A practical, implementable solution that can be directly applied
Clear explanation of which parameter controls the iteration limit

    model=model,
)

    agent=home_automation_agent,
    name="home_automation",
    description="Controls the home automation system."
)

sms_agent = ToolCallingAgent(

    model=model,
)

managed_sms_agent = ManagedAgent( 
    agent=sms_agent,
    name="sms",

)

agent = CodeAgent(
    model=model,
    tools=[],
    managed_agents=[managed_home_automation_agent, managed_sms_agent],
)
```
author: vqndev

comments.body:
Hi @vqndev, thank you for submitting!
This is a great example of self-healing in a multi-step agent!
In step 0, `gpt4o-mini` does a mistake by calling a tool incorrectly. Then it rectifies the code in the second step (because it saw the error message in its memory) and finally solves the task!

All in all it's not a framework issue, it's just the LLM being dumb! Which often happens with smaller LLMs, GPT-4o would be less likely to do this first mistake.
Thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: Acknowledgment that the observed behavior is expected and not a framework bug
Understanding of why the LLM initially used the wrong function call syntax
Recognition of the self-healing behavior as a feature rather than a bug

title: Issue installing on ARM 64 MacOS 151.1
body:
### Describe the bug

Following the install instructions for Anaconda and Apple Silicon Mac mini M2 I see the following error with the 
```conda env create```
step. I am getting the following error dump

```(base) john@john-macmini tbp.monty % conda env create -f environment_arm64.yml  
Channels:
 - aihabitat
 - pytorch
 - pyg
 - defaults
 - conda-forge
Platform: osx-arm64
Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done
Solving environment: failed

LibMambaUnsatisfiableError: Encountered problems while solving:
  - nothing provides requested aihabitat::habitat-sim =0.2.2*
  - nothing provides requested mkl <2022
  - nothing provides blas * mkl needed by pytorch-1.11.0.arm64-py3.8_0

Could not solve for environment specs
The following packages are incompatible
â”œâ”€ habitat-sim 0.2.2*  does not exist (perhaps a typo or a missing channel);
â”œâ”€ mkl <2022  does not exist (perhaps a typo or a missing channel);
â””â”€ pytorch 1.11.0*  is not installable because it requires
   â””â”€ blas * mkl, which does not exist (perhaps a missing channel).
```

I am running the following Python version
```(base) john@john-macmini tbp.monty % python --version
Python 3.12.7
```
author: doonhammer

comments.body:
Hi @doonhammer, I'm sorry that the install instructions are not working.

On Apple's ARM 64, the Anaconda instructions require to specify the environment file explicitly:
```
conda env create -f environment_arm64.yml
```
Is the above command the one that generated the error?

If you still get the same error even when specifying `-f environment_arm64.yml`, this may be a similar problem described in #81. There, the solution seemed to be to use the Miniconda setup instructions (if you're using `zsh` shell):
```
conda env create -f environment_arm64.yml --subdir=osx-64
conda init zsh
conda activate tbp.monty
conda config --env --set subdir osx-64
```
Or if you're using `bash` or some other shell:
```
conda env create -f environment_arm64.yml --subdir=osx-64
conda init
conda activate tbp.monty
conda config --env --set subdir osx-64
```
Adding --subdir=osx-64 did the trick with Anaconda install. Install succeeded and all tests passed. Thanks for the help

satisfaction_conditions: A working installation method for ARM 64 MacOS that resolves package compatibility issues
A solution that works with the user's existing Anaconda setup
A complete installation process that allows tests to pass

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM python:3.8-slim

# Set environment variables
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 \
    PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    git \
    wget \
    ca-certificates \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Miniconda
WORKDIR /tmp
RUN wget -q https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh -O miniconda.sh && \
    bash miniconda.sh -b -p /opt/conda && \
    rm miniconda.sh

# Add conda to PATH
ENV PATH="/opt/conda/bin:${PATH}"

# Create workspace directory
WORKDIR /workspace

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/thousandbrainsproject/tbp.monty.git && \
    cd tbp.monty && \
    git checkout f93ff45936c055a7b1f8e15bc3ce16a7fa29868d

# Set working directory to the cloned repository
WORKDIR /workspace/tbp.monty

# Create a modified environment file for compatibility
RUN echo "name: tbp.monty" > environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "channels:" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - pytorch" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - conda-forge" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - defaults" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "dependencies:" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - python=3.8" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - pytorch=1.13.0" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - torchvision" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - pip" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "  - pip:" >> environment_modified.yml && \
    echo "    - -e ." >> environment_modified.yml

# Create and activate the conda environment
RUN conda env create -f environment_modified.yml && \
    conda clean -afy

# Add conda environment activation to bash startup
SHELL ["/bin/bash", "-c"]
RUN echo "source activate tbp.monty" > ~/.bashrc

# Set the default command to activate the conda environment
CMD ["/bin/bash", "-c", "source activate tbp.monty && /bin/bash"]

title: Wait to run the Agent first step until Input guardrails is complete
body:
The guardrail may trigger a Tripewire but the agent still run

In v0.0.7, the code runs the input guardrail task and the agent's first step together asynchronously. 

If the guardrail is in place to avoid a side effect from the Agent run, the agent may still do something unexpected.


Let's say that you have a tripwire guardrail: "Don't allow to delete a file", and the agent is an MCP file system agent
author: rach

comments.body:
the current behavior is the intended/documented behavior. If you want to run the guardrail _before_ the agent runs, you can just do that via python code:
```
triggered = await do_something()
if not triggered:
  await Runner.run(...)
```

For my own understanding. What was the rational to have the agent start before the guardrail is done?
I can work around it, now that I know the behavior.
@rach for latency. If the guardrail doesn't fail, then you will have made a bunch of progress on the actual agent. RUnning (guardrail, agent) in parallel is much faster than serially

satisfaction_conditions: Explanation of the design rationale behind the current behavior
Clarification of the current system behavior regarding guardrails and agent execution
Practical workaround for implementing sequential guardrail-then-agent execution

title: How to provide object as input to agent
body:
Hi Team,

I am trying to create an agent which will use function tool approach to call my python method to extract the text from a excel file. So I have to provide the file as an input. How can I do it?

```

class ExtractionItem(BaseModel):
    extractedText: str
    """The extracted text from the document.."""

===== Agent Instantiation====
text_extractor_agent = Agent(
        name="Text Extraction Agent",
        instructions=PROMPT,
        model="gpt-4o",
        tools=[text_extraction],
        output_type=ExtractionItem
    )

====== Function call =======

@function_tool
async def text_extraction(input_excel_file):
    try:
        logic to extract the text
    except Exception as e:
        issues = str(e)

    result = ExtractionItem(
        extractedText=extracted text
    )
    return result

```
Now while calling the agent how can i provide file as an input? Please help me
author: puneetsharma7445

comments.body:
Hi, there are several methods. I don't know what you need to do on the excel file, therefore I provide you with some generic examples.

The first method is to make the model pass the input file name (you have to pay attention to the actual path of the file):
```python
from agents import (
    Agent,
    ModelSettings,
    RunContextWrapper,
    Runner,
    function_tool,
)
import pandas as pd
from pydantic import BaseModel

@function_tool
def text_extraction(file_path: str):
    """
    It returns the excel file data.
    """
    try:
        df = pd.read_excel(file_path)
        return df.to_csv()
    except Exception as exc:
        return f"Failed to read excel file, due to exception: {exc}."

class ExtractionItem(BaseModel):
    """The extracted text from the document.."""
    extractedText: str

async def main():
    agent = Agent(
        name="Text extraction agent",
        model="gpt-4o-mini",
        instructions="You are a helpful agent, your task is to extract info from an excel file.",
        tools=[text_extraction],
        model_settings=ModelSettings(
            max_tokens=1024
        ),
        output_type=ExtractionItem
    )
    # Example of user input
    user_input = "I want to extract all the user names from the file 'excel_test.xlsx'"
    result = await Runner.run(agent, input=user_input)
    print(result.final_output)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(main())
```

While the second approach may be to read the file and put it in the context:
```python
from dataclasses import dataclass
import io

@dataclass
class ContextInfo:
    excel_file: io.BytesIO = None

@function_tool
def text_extraction(context: RunContextWrapper[ContextInfo]):
    """
    It returns the excel file data.
    """
    try:
        df = pd.read_excel(context.context.excel_file)
        return df.to_csv()
    except Exception as exc:
        return f"Failed to read excel file, due to exception: {exc}."


async def main():
    agent = Agent(
        name="Text extraction agent",
        model="gpt-4o-mini",
        instructions="You are a helpful agent, your task is to extract info from an excel file.",
        tools=[text_extraction],
        model_settings=ModelSettings(
            max_tokens=1024
        ),
        output_type=ExtractionItem
    )

    user_input = "I want to extract all the user names from the excel file."
    result = await Runner.run(
        agent, input=user_input,
        context=ContextInfo(excel_file=open("excel_test.xlsx", "rb"))
    )
    print(result.final_output)
```

For both methods, you need to install `pandas` and `openpyxl` to read the Excel file. I also suggest being cautious when passing an entire file, as it may contain a large number of tokens.
Hope this may be useful for your use case!
Context is a good thing.

Tool calling is via JSON inputs and string outputs. So the LLM is unable to pass a file directly in the tool call, but it can pass a reference to the file as @DanieleMorotti mentioned. For example, file name, path, etc.

Thanks for the help and support @DanieleMorotti .

I was struggling with approach to pass input parameters to the Tool. I am able to proceed now.

satisfaction_conditions: A method to provide a file as input to an agent's function tool
Practical examples showing how to pass file data to function tools
